loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana, 42 and married, lives in Pulot, Ozamiz City. She generates money through her junk shop business. She has operated this kind of business activity for almost 13 years. It means that their source of living is her junk shop store. 

Fortunately, because of the high demand of the customers, she needs to buy a weighing scale for her junk shop business. She is borrowing money from PMPC. In addition to that, she became a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale for her junk shop business.

loans.name: Alexandria

texts.en:
Alexandria is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past four years, Alexandria has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells neccessity commodities. 

To help expand her business, Alexandria has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items to sale, and will help Alexandria to generate greater profits and take care of basic family needs. Alexandria hopes that in the future she will be able to open a wholesale shop in the area. 

Alexandria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alexandria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph does motorcycle transportation and has been in this business for the last three years. He is 26 years old and single.

He plans to use this loan to buy his own motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his standard of living. Having paid all his previous loans successfully, this will be his third loan from KADET LTD.

In future he hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 40 years old and married to Jannefer.  He does farming in Emali town, where he keeps dairy cows.  His spouse, who is also a farmer, provides additional income.  Besides farming he also has a motorcycle transport business.  He plans to use this loan to buy another motorcycle and thereby grow his transport business.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.  This is his sixth loan term and he paid back his previous loans successfully.  In the future Patrick hopes to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary does dairy farming in Kangundo town and has been in this business for the last 12 years. She supplies milk to various customers and it has been profitable. She is 39 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She will use this loan to buy another dairy cow as well as buy more stock of cow feeds. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farming business. 

This is her third loan term and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to grow her farming by keeping goats, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow and cow feeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 25 years old and has a grocery business in Kangundo town.  She has been running it for five years now and it has been profitable.  She is married and together with her spouse has been blessed with three children.  She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, carrots, onions, tomatoes, bananas, and oranges for sale.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.  This is her fourth loan term and she paid back her previous loans successfully.  In the future Julia hopes to expand her business and open another grocery store and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, fruits and carrots.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua has a retail shop in Kangundo town where he sells household goods as well as sweets and cakes.  He has been in this business for six years now and it has been profitable.  He is 51 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with three children.  He plans to use the loan to buy thermos flasks for keeping tea and hot water, cups, plastic buckets, and face towels. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.  This is his third loan term and he paid back all the previous loans successfully. In the future Joshua hopes to be a successful businessman as well as educate his children.

loans.use: To buy thermos flasks, cups, face towels, and buckets.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking businesswoman and lives in Oroquieta City. She owns a store and earns an approximate income of PHP 5,000 per month. Elsa is toying with the idea of expanding her business through additional inventories. She has reached out to PMPC to assist with the purchase of additional stock like basic commodities.

Being a member of good standing, Elsa enjoys the benefits that the cooperative has offered like the insurance, savings and credit. Elsa hopes to maintain a good record with PMPC and wishes to repay her obligation in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.  She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pig fattening business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Busca Del Exito Group

texts.es: Doña Jaide es la presidenta de Banco Mujer En Busca Del Éxito, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene una hija de 19 años que estudia enfermería. Doña Jaide es una mujer muy trabajadora, y comerciante con mucha experiencia, vende de forma ambulante por su comunidad y otras aledañas, ropa de mujer, ropa interior, sandalias, cosméticos, perfumes y otros productos. Este es el quinto préstamos que recibe, y los anteriores han sido de gran ayuda para contribuir con los gastos de su familia pero principalmente ayudar a pagar los estudios de su hija, su mayor deseo es ver a su hija graduarse de enfermera, y que en un futuro sea ella quien esté pendiente del bienestar de sus padres, y los cuide en su vejez, porque Doña Jaide le gusta pensar en el futuro, y otra de sus aspiraciones es ayudar a su esposo en un plan que tiene a corto plazo de reparar su casa, ya que está en muy mal estado. Junto a Doña Jaide hay 7 socias más que van a invertir en actividades de comercio, servicios y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Jaide is the president of the "Mujer en Busca del Éxito" communal bank.  She is 45 years old, married and has a 19-year-old daughter who is studying nursing.  Jaide is very hard-working and an experienced businesswoman.  She works as a street vendor in her community and in the surrounding areas.  She sells women's clothing, underwear, sandals, cosmetics, perfumes, and other products.  This is her fifth loan; the previous loans have been of great help to her, helping to cover household costs and, above all, helping to pay for her daughter's studies.  Jaide's biggest desires are to see her daughter graduate to become a nurse and that, in the future, she will look after her parents' well-being in their old age.  Jaide likes to think about the future.  Another of her aspirations is to help her husband with his short-term plan to do repair work in the house, which is currently in a very bad state.  

Alongside Jaide, there are seven other member of the "Mujer en Busca de Éxito" group who will invest in their various businesses offering different products and services, and in the farming sector.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, underwear, sandals, make-up, perfume, and other products.

loans.name: Sharame

texts.en: Sharame is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sharame is 27 years old and has two children who are still in school.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Sharame has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.  Sharame has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi appreciates your support. Her previous loan helped her to buy construction materials. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy more bricks to sell in order to get more profit and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy more bricks to sell in order to get more profit.

loans.name: Emiline

texts.en: Emiline is a married woman with one child who attends school.  She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.  She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, invertirá de nuevo en su negocio, efectuará la compra de plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono y pagara mano de obra para realizar la siembra de maíz, teniendo el capital necesario el estará seguro de que su siembra se realizara en el tiempo adecuado.
La inversión que hizo con el crédito le dio una mejor cosecha, aumentaron sus ganancias, su familia goza de mejor alimentación, salud, también ha cancelado la deuda que adquirió en su momento.
texts.en:
Lucio will invest the loan in his business by buying weed killer, insecticide, manure and paying for manual labor to sow his corn crops. With the necessary capital, he's sure that the harvest will happen in the adequate time.

This loan will give him a better crop, increase his earnings, improve his family's nutrition and health, and help him pay off a loan.

loans.use: buy weed killer, insecticide, manure and manual labor.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, está acompañada, tiene un hijo, vive junto a ellos una vida hogareña, se dedica a vender verduras, gallinas y cerdos, es un negocio que le enseño su mamá, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de gallinas, cerdos y verduras como güisquiles, tomates, cebollas, le ayudara a  tener un negocio más surtido, satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, mejorar su economía y cancelar el préstamo.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio para aumentar su clientela y seguir apoyando a su compañero de vida en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosa has a partner and one son, with whom she lives.  Rosa works selling vegetables, hens, and pigs.  She learned to run this business from her mother.  Rosa works from 8am until 5pm.

Rosa will use this loan to buy hens, pigs, and vegetables, such as pear squash, tomatoes, and onions. The loan will help Rosa have a better-stocked business, satisfy her customers, and improve her financial situation.  This will then help her to pay off her loan.

Rosa dreams of having a bigger business in order to increase her number of customers and to continue supporting her life partner with household costs.

loans.use: to buy hens, pigs, and vegetables.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 34 years old and married. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. This will help her to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

This is her first loan with BRAC and Kiva as well.

loans.use: To buy buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the irrigation and to prepare the vineyard for the winter

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen is an experienced agronomist from Armash village of Ararat region. He lives with his wife and two sons (21 and 17 years old). With the help of his wife, Shahen has been extensively engaged in agribusiness for more than 15 years. He is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture and in the cultivation of tomatoes, melons, peaches, apricots, apples, pears and walnut. His sons help him realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Shahen needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fertilizers, to buy tree layers, and to pay for the harvesting services. Shahen and his family members rely highly on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in lending the needed amount of his requested loan to maintain and develop the family's agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, to buy tree layers, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla es originaria de Chinandega, casada y madre de cuatro hijos. De 44 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Negocio que heredó de su mamá hace cinco años, el cual ha logrado mantener muy estable y próspero. Actualmente le ha generado buenos ingresos. Solicita  el crédito para comprar: pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, camisolas entre otros, con el fin de brindar mercadería diversificada y de calidad. Estima que este crédito le ayudara a cumplir sus metas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Karla, 44, is from Chinandega.  She's married and the mother of four children.  She's a merchant and makes a living selling clothing.  She inherited the business from her mother five years ago and has managed to keep it stable and prosperous.  Currently it has earned good income for her.

Karla's requesting the loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, and other clothing so she has a variety of quality merchandise to sell.  She thinks this loan will help her achieve her goals and earn better profits.

Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Yader Antonio

texts.es: Yader es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega, casado y padre de una hija. De  33 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al alquiler de nitendo. Inicio con el negocio hace 2 años; él trabaja como taxista, pero tiene su negocio de nitendo, el cual lo ayuda su esposa. Solicita el crédito para comprar: consolas de play station 2, controles y unos televisores con el fin de ampliar su negocio. Estima que este crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá suplir con la demanda de sus clientes que lo visitan, y sobre todo le generara ingresos. Su plan futuro es poner un cyber y mantener el negocio del nitendo, para que los  jóvenes y adulto puedan distraerse sanamente.
texts.en:
Yader, 33, is from the city of Chinandega.  He's married and the father of a daughter.  He's a merchant and rents Nintendo games.  He started the business two years ago.  He works as a taxi driver but he has a Nintendo business where his wife helps him.

Yader's requesting the loan to buy Play Station 2 consoles, controls, and some television sets to expand his business.  He thinks this loan will be beneficial because he'll be able to meet customer demand, which will generate income for him.

His plan for the future is to start an internet café and keep the Nintendo business so young people and adults can engage in healthy entertainment.

loans.use: to buy Play Station 2 consoles, controls, and television sets

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the region of Uganda. She is married and has six children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Annet has been working hard to manage her furniture shop. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more furniture for the store, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. 

Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the welfare of her children and herself. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for the store

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Delapa, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a carpenter. Also, they have both engaged in the rice farming business since they got married and have earned a monthly income of 3,000. 

Perlita has requested a new loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer. She really wants to earn more income and savings for her children who are still studying.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 44 years old; she is married and has two children. She lives in Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. 

Ma. Linda has engaged in fruit and vegetable vending for four years, and earned a monthly income of 4,000. Her husband is a farmer and also supports the family for their daily consumption and school expenses of their children. 

Ma. Linda requested a new loan to purchase materials for kitchen repair. 

She is a responsible mother who aims to have savings for her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to be used to repair their kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a hotel business, which she has been running for 13 years now. She is 38 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with seven children. Her spouse also provides additional income.

Joyce plans to use this loan to buy baking and maize flour, rice, sugar, cereals, and cooking oil for use in her hotel. This will enable her to serve many customers as well as to make more profits. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards and also help her relatives' children. 

This is Jane's first loan term and in the future she hopes to have a successful business and provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Naade

texts.en:
Naade is 35 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children. She has a cereals selling business, which she has been running for four years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

Naade plans to use this loan to buy more stock of maize, beans, and peas to sell. She anticipates making more profits which she will use to pay school fees for her children. 

This is Naade's third loan term and she repaid all her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize, beans, and peas to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old, married, and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming sugarcane for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 38 years old and married with four children, two whom are in school.  Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs an Avon products direct selling business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like lotion, shampoo, and other Avon products to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like lotion, shampoo, and other Avon products to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 43 years old and married with two children who are in school. Divina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, soap, etc. to sell.

Divina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sulma Reina

texts.es:
Sulma, invertirá nuevamente en su negocio por lo que solita otro crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, pues de esta manera tendrá un inventario muy surtido para la época navideña y también seguirá satisfaciendo a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior logro un negocio más competitivo, aumento sus ventas, atrajo a nuevos clientes, su economía mejoro, su familia tiene un estilo de vida completamente diferente y la sigue apoyando para que siga adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sulma's going to invest in her business again so she's requesting another loan to buy clothing for children, women, and men.  This way she'll have a well-stocked inventory for the Christmas season and will continue satisfying her customers.

With the previous loan she was able to have a more competitive business, she increased her sales and attracted new customers, and her finances improved.  Her family has a completely different lifestyle and she continues to support them so she can get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a widowed woman and has four children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Jane has operated a cereals business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, Jane wants to purchase stock of maize grain for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize grain for resale.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is from Taperavan, a village of the Ararat region. He lives with his wife and three school-age sons (eleven, nine and six years old). Hayk is employed in the private sector and is the only breadwinner of the family. However, he cannot fully meet his family's needs based on his salary alone. 

Hayk is engaged in breeding a livestock of pigs, in viniculture, and in the cultivation of barley, peaches, apricots, plums and pears. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for the family. Hayk's wife assists him greatly in his daily activities related to farming. 

To be able to continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hayk needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase cable and pipes for viniculture, to buy some fertilizers, to purchase wheat seeds, and to pay for harvesting services. Hayk and his family rely heavily on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan for maintaining and developing his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cable and pipes for viniculture, to buy some fertilizers, to purchase wheat seeds, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Ahmarbek

texts.en:
Ahmarbek was born in the year 1959. He is a careful father of six children and a lovely grandfather of some grandchildren. His wife is a kind woman. 

Ahmarbek worked in many jobs with the aim to earn a living. He has been busy for last eight years with business. He sells food items in his food store which is located in the center of the region. Ahmarbek sells bread, butter, sugar, vegetables and other goods. 

Ahmarbek needs your financial support. He must organize a wedding party for his child, but he does not have the money. He is asking for a loan to throw a wedding party. He awaits your support and thanks you in advance for your charity.

loans.use: To throw a wedding party for his son

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangatii in Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken and eggs. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for her business and will help Mariam generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the chicken farm into a bigger business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for her business

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.en: Khayrullo is smart man who has a higher education. He is a journalist. Khayrullo has worked in this field more than six years. Khayrullo writes articles for a newspaper; he is a good writer. He lives with his wife, two children and his mother. Now, there is a problem in his family. His mother is ill. Khayrullo must help her treat her illness, but he does not have the money. He has a small salary. He is asking for a loan to buy medicine for treatment for his mother. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment for his mother.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her computer shop. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a mobile money agent line for her business, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and eradicate poverty. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to add to her business. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile money agent line for her business

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is married and has a recycled materials/old tires business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years now. Charita works hard to support her family. 

Charita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more old tires for making flower pots, garbage containers, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more old tires for making flower pots, garbage containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now. Jenelyn works hard to support her family. 

Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leny Rose

texts.en:
Leny Rose is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now. Leny Rose works hard to support her family. 

Leny Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has a cereals shop in Oloitoktok town and has been in this business for four years now. She is 43 years old and widowed with one child. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She also has a mobile money transfer business.

Josephine plans to use this loan to buy maize and rice to sell in her business. This will enable her to meet her customers' needs, as well as earn more income. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child. This is her third loan term and she repaid all her previous loans successfully. 

In the future, Josephine hopes to educate her child and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been operating a clothing sales business.The previous loan helped her to buy bales of clothes for sale, and she received a good profit which in turn helped her to boost the family.

Here again, she is requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She wants to purchase one more bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is the age of 48 and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a weaver and knits blankets at home. For knitting blankets wool is used as raw material. There is no better kind of the blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones. 

Her husband is very expert and knits very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-intensive procedure, as he knits blankets over multiple nights. This is the reason her husband sells them at a high price, but the problem is the customers do not agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing over time.

Her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knitting blankets, but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knitting blankets, which could generate an increase in income.

loans.use: To buy wool for knitting blankets to sell.

loans.name: Sheyla Patricia

texts.es: Sheyla es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, casada y madre de 2 hijos. De 29 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Inicio con su negocio vendiendo caramelos en el mercado de la ciudad hace 16 años, poco a poco fue adquiriendo dinero para tener su negocio estable y fijo ahora. Actualmente vende frutas y verduras. Solicita este crédito para comprar pan, banano, naranjas, manzanas, verduras entre otros con el fin de ofrecer una cantidad de productos a sus clientes que la visiten. Estima que este crédito le ayudara a crecer su negocio y suplir la demanda de su clientela. Su plan futuro es extender su negocio empleando a mujeres para poder distribuir sus productos
texts.en: Sheyla is from the city of Chinandega. She 's married and has 2 children. She's 29 years old. She works in commerce, selling fruits and vegetables. She started her business selling candy in the city market 16 years ago. Little by little she made the capital necessary to establish her business. Currently, she sells fruits and vegetables. In order to offer her clients the amount of produce they need, she's requesting this loan to buy bread, bananas, oranges, apples and vegetables, among others. She thinks this loan will help her grow her business and fulfill client demand. Her future plan is to extend her business by employing women who can distribute her products.

loans.use: buy bread, bananas, oranges, apples and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Kholnazar

texts.ru:
Холназар житель села района Кубадиён. Ему 29 лет. Он воспитанный и ответственный мужчина. Холназара воспитали быть целеустремленным и знать уважение к взрослым. Он работает упорно, чтобы улучшить жизненные условия своим близким. В состав его семьи входят его родители пенсионеры, жена и дети. Его жена работает в колхозе. Холназар занимается растениеводством, сажает овощи и огурцы. 
   Приближается зима и Холназар спешит посадить картошку и пшеницу, чтобы к весне получить урожай. Для этого он просит кредит ему не хватает средств для покупки минеральных удобрений и пшеницы. Чтобы реализовать посев еще не поздно. Потому что зима в Таджикистан приходит позднее чем в других странах. Но Холназар не расслабляется и скорее хочет посадить урожай.
texts.en:
Kholnazar is a resident of a village in the Kubadiyon region. He is 29 years old. He is an educated and responsible man. Kholnazar was raised to be purposeful and to respect his elders. He works hard, in order to improve the living conditions of his loved ones. In composition, his family includes his retired parents, wife and children. His wife works on a collective farm. Kholnazar is engaged in agriculture, growing vegetables and cucumbers.

Winter is coming and Kholnazar is in a hurry to plant potatoes and wheat, so in the spring he will have a crop. For this, he is asking for a loan because his resources are not enough to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat. It is not too late to realize the planting, because winter in Tajikistan comes later than in other countries. But Kholnazar is not relaxing and quickly wants to plant a crop.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her tailoring business. Her income from her business has assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.
 
Lydia would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy thread, needles, cloth, and other supplies needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lydia dreams of having additional sewing machines and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for thread, needles, cloth, and other supplies needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is a native man from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He goes fishing. He catches and sells fish to help augment the income of their household. His business started quite a few years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat and fishing nets, to increase his daily catch.

In the future, Levi hopes to expand his fishing and increase his business profitability to generate more and stable income.

loans.use: to buy  fuel for the boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 38 years old and lives in the town of Najjera in Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past six years, Amos has been working hard to manage his internet cafe business, which provides internet access to patrons. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more computers, which will help Amos generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to provide enough internet services to meet demand. 

Amos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more computers for his internet cafe business

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
This is Janice. She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Janice would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janice hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her family will always be in good health.  She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for new stocks of winter clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase aditional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is 34 years old and married with five children.
Jackielyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, feeds, rice, noodles, snack foods and other groceries to sell.
Jackielyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.
Jackielyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, feeds, rice, noodles, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica works hard to support three children. She has a live-in partner and she has a corn farming business in the Philippines.

Dorica requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency. Dorica is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazards and risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 57 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs.

Felina has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Carmela

texts.es: Ana, a sus 35 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Hace aproximadamente 6 años inició su propia sala de belleza con la cual ha generado ingresos para sustentar las necesidades básicas del hogar y para brindar educación a sus hijos. La actividad la conoció gracias a su madre, quien tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en una ciudad de la costa Caribe y su primer trabajo como independiente lo realizó con una plancha alisadora de cabello, prestando el servicio a domicilio; pero, por dificultades familiares tuvo que desistir de esta labor, pues no tenía con quien dejar a sus hijos para que los cuidaran mientras ella trabajaba. Por esta razón decidió montar el salón de belleza en su casa, allí presta el servicio  y genera recursos económicos, mientras está pendiente de sus hijos. Actualmente requiere el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (mesas, espejos, sillas de peluquería, lava cabezas, entre otros) de esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y además podrá brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos por la prestación del servicio, que aumenta en la temporada de navidad. Ana desea continuar con su actividad y hacer que su negocio sea próspero y competitivo, para así generar una mejor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para su familia, que le dé la oportunidad de disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida y bienestar al lado de los que ama.
texts.en: Ana, 35 years old, is a mother of two children and lives in a common law marriage with her partner. Approximately 6 years ago, she began her own beauty salon with which she has generated income to sustain the basic needs of the household and to provide education to her children. She came to learn this trade thanks to her mother, who has a beauty salon located in a city on the Caribbean coast. Her first job she had as an independent was with hair straighteners, as an in-home service; but due to family difficulties she had to stop this work, as she didn't have anyone with whom to leave the children to care for them while she worked. For this reason she decided to start a beauty salon in her home. There she provides services and generates economic resources, while caring for her children. Today she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (tables, mirrors, hair dressing chairs, washing stations, etc.). In this way she will be able to improve working conditions and also be able to provide better convenience to her customers, which will increase her income from the services that increase in the Christmas season. Ana wants to continue her trade and making a business that will be prosperous and competitive, so that she can generate reliable and stable income for her family that will give her the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life and well being at the side of those that she loves.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (tables, mirrors, hairdressing chairs, washing stations, etc.)

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 48 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; all of them work in a small firm. Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the financial conditions of his family. This restaurant has been cherished by her whole family for many years.

Now, Shamim's husband wants to offer more menu items to his valuable customers so that he can increase his income. Shamim is taking a loan for the restaurant. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. She is hopeful that this loan will result in more profits and savings as well.

Shamim thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy food items such as chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. to increase the menu items at her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos fue soldado profesional pero, cansado de esta labor, decidió pedir la baja y con algunos ahorros que tenía, decidió emprender su propio negocio, una litografía que se encuentra ubicada en su lugar de residencia, allí trabaja en compañía de su esposa todos los días de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm, imprimiendo libros que saca a circulación y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para brindar sustento a su esposa y a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad.  Actualmente solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (papel, cartón y tintas), con la que podrá imprimir mayor cantidad de libros para comercializarlos y así generar los ingresos con los que sustenta las necesidades de su familia. Carlos sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro desea poder independizarlo de su unidad familiar, pues el espacio en el que trabaja es reducido y algunas veces incómodo, y sabe que logrando esta independencia entre hogar y negocio, podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de los que ama.
texts.en:
Carlos was a professional soldier, but tired of this work, he decided to ask for leave, and with some savings he had, decided to start his own business, a lithograph press located in his home. There he works with his wife every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., printing books that he publishes, and this way generates enough resources to support his wife and their small three-year-old son. 

Currently he is requesting his first loan, so that he can invest in the purchase of supplies at wholesale (paper, cardboard and inks), with which he will be able to print a greater quantity of books to sell, and generate the income with which he supports his family's needs. 

Carlos dreams of making his business grow and someday wishes to be able to go out on his own from the family home, as the space in which he works is limited and sometimes inconvenient, and he knows that by achieving this independence between home and business he will be able to improve the quality of life of those he loves.

loans.use: To buy supplies at wholesale, such as paper, cardboard and inks.

loans.name: Elsa Emerita

texts.es:
Elsa de 62 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos  mayores de edad, es originaria de Jinotega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar y se dedico al negocio desde muy joven para tener un medio de ingresos para sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de ropa nueva como camisetas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa de niño, juego de toallas, camisas mangas largas, juegos de cama. Ella dedica a su negocio  unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos y lo tiene ubicado en un lugar establecido de la  localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Elsa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 62-year-old single mother of 3 children who are now adults. She's from Jinotega, a region that's in the north of the country. She is hard working, responsible and motivated to better herself. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to study so she started working in commerce at a young age in order to raise her children.
Thanks to her efforts and her motivation to get ahead, her economic activity is selling new clothing, like t-shirts, shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, children's clothing, towel sets, long-sleeved shirts and bed sheet sets. She dedicates 12-hours-a-day to her business selling her products. Her business is located in an established area. The objective of the loan is to invest in business capital and stock up on merchandise for the business, so that in the near future she can increase her income. Elsa is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders give to those who lack resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: invest in work capital for her business and stock up on merchandise, like t-shirts, shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, children's clothing, towel sets, long-sleeved shirts, bed sheets.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр молодой студент в возрасте 20 лет. Он учится в третьем курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета в факультете Финансы и рыночная экономика по специальности бухгалтерский учет и аудит. Он прилежный студент и учится усердно. Сейчас его главная цель - успешно закончить университет и сделать себе карьеру по своей специальности. Бахтиёр родился в семье педагогов. Его отец и мать работают в детском саде. Отец педагог по пению, а мать воспитательница. Они очень хотят, чтобы их сын имел высшее образование и нашел достойную работу. Бахтиёр в этом году еще не оплатил за учебу. Приближается уже конец года и ему необходимо успеть с оплатой. Единственное решение Бахтиёр видит в получении кредита. Он очень нуждается в этом кредите и просит поддержки.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is a young student of 20. He is studying in the third course at the Khujand State University in the department of Finance and the Market Economy with a specialization in accounting and audit. He is a diligent student and studies hard. Now his main goal is to graduate successfully from university and to make himself a career in his specialty.

Bakhtiyor was born into a family of teachers. His father and mother work in a kindergarten. His father is a singing teacher, and his mother is a teacher. They want very much that their son will have a higher education and find a decent job.

Bakhtiyor still has not paid for this year's studies. The end of the year is approaching and he needs to succeed with the payment. The only solution that Bakhtiyor sees is receiving a loan. He really needs this loan and is asking for support.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат юная продавщица продуктового магазина. Ей 22 года. Уже около трех лет Салтанат работает в магазине. У Салтаната есть высшее образование. Она педагог. Но Салтанал пошла по стопам своих родителей и стала работать в сфере торговли продуктов питания. Салтанат не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители помогают ей по работе. На данный момент Салтанат чувствует затруднение, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Она просит кредит для расширения ассортимента продукции в ее магазине. С помощью кредита она приобретет больше продуктов, соответственно увеличится число ее клиентов. Салтанат надеется, что таким способом увеличит доход и внесет свои вклады в семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Saltanat is a young saleswoman in a grocery store. She is 22 years old. For about three years already, Saltanat has been working in the store. Saltanat has a higher education. She is a teacher. But Saltanat followed in her parents' footsteps and started to work in the grocery business. Saltanat is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents help her in her work.

Currently, Saltanat is experiencing difficulties with expanding her activities. She is requesting a loan for expanding the assortment of products in her store. With the help of the loan, she will acquire more products, and correspondingly increase the number of her customers. Saltanat hopes that in this way she will increase her income and bring her share of the family budget.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of food products

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is married and has two children who have helped her in taking care of their corn. 

After 21 years of growing and harvesting corn, Avelina earns enough that she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

To earn additional income, she also runs a general store, and she recently borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods for sale. 

Avelina wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 38 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Geraldine is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Geraldine has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: Doña María es una clienta con 50 años de edad, casada  y tiene 4 hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo, un hijo menor y otro mayor. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Se dedica a su actividad sin descuidar a su familia. Ella vende oro y plata laminada, también vende por catálogo. Hace varios años inició su negocio con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo económicamente en las necesidades del hogar. También para tener independencia económica y sentirse bien al socializarse con las demás personas. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y personas de su misma comunidad. Ella pertenecía a un banco mujer, el cual se desintegró, pero ella creció y ahora solicita un financiamiento para reforzar su negocio, asi superarse y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: María is a client that is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Today she lives with her husband, her younger son and another older son. She is a very hardworking woman and is eager to excel. She works without neglecting her family. She sells gold and silver plated jewelry. She also sells by catalog. Some years ago she began her business with the end of helping her husband economically with the household needs. She also likes having economic independence and socializing with other people. Her customers are neighbors, family and people of her own community. She belonged to a women's bank, which disbanded, but she has grown and is now requesting financing to strengthen her business, also improving herself and the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fine jewelry.

loans.name: Herdine

texts.en:
Herdine works hard to support two children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Herdine requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall. Herdine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazards and risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school. Ma. Glenda works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Glenda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other items to sell .

Ma. Glenda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other items to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu has operated a shoe selling business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a sports kits  business in the future. Here again she comes to you requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more shoes to sell to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Hawa from the Waterloo2 eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with one child. She started a business to take care of her family. 

Hawa runs a foodstand business at home.  She sells rice, fish, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Hawa says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Hawa has requested a loan to buy more cooking items like rice, fish, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items, like rice, fish, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a mother of five children who are all in school. She is a market vendor, and she mainly sells beverages as well as groceries. She started the business in 2010, and she started it with a motive of making money so that she could be in a position to raise her children. She works six days in a week, and her business is located in a cell in Ishaka town, where she has been since 2010. Her clients are mainly the families in Ishaka town.

She believes that if she gets a loan of 1,000,000 shillings, her business will expand and she will get enough money to pay tuition for her children. She would like to buy more stock using the loan money so that she makes more profits, which will in the long run help her to pay school fees and see all her children through school. Her major challenge is rainy weather, but she is hopeful that it will be over with time.

loans.use: To buy beverages and groceries to sell

loans.name: Black Smith Development Group

texts.en:
Atanasi is a 37-year-old member of the Black Smith Development Group. He is married and has three children, ages 15, 12, and 4 and all of them attend school.

Atanasi started this job of scrap collecting twelve years ago. His daily job routine is waking up early in the morning and moving around Kampala city in search of old metallic materials that are useful for making things like charcoal stoves and saucepans that are among the things he sells to earn a living.

Atanasi loves his family and he is willing to work harder each day to provide the best life for them. He approached Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) for a second loan after completing the first that was given to him four months ago to boost his business. He will use this loan for buying other material that he needs to make new stoves and saucepans.

loans.use: To buy materials for making charcoal stoves and saucepans

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 34-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and a son.

Allah Rakhi's husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious food. Her husband appointed a worker over his restaurant; a few days ago he broke most of the crockery during washing. Now Allah Rakhi's husband does not have sufficient crockery to offer food to maximum customers. He wants to buy crockery and some benches for seating.

Therefore, Allah Rakhi requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy crockery and benches for seating. She thanks to Kiva and appreciates the warm support towards her.

loans.use: To buy crockery and benches for the restaurant.

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en:
Jovans is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the region of Kampala South in Uganda. She is married and has seven children, with three of them currently in school. 

For the past 15 years, Jovans has been working hard to manage her farming business:  She rears goats. 

To help expand her business, Jovans has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goats.  It will help Jovans to generate greater profits and improve on the stock of her business by buying more goats and also taking care of her medical bills. 

Jovans hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another business. 

Jovans is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jovans who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Dustmurod

texts.ru: Дустмурод 26-летний молодой человек, проживает в районе Рудаки. Он занимается собственным бизнесом уже 10 лет. Дустмурод имеет продуктовый магазин. Он продает там продукты питания, а также овощи и фрукты. Дустмурод дорожит бизнесом, так как за счет него он обеспечивает свою семью - жену, двоих детей и родителей. Он единственный кормилец семьи. Сейчас ему необходимо увеличить ассортимент продуктов питания в своем магазине. Для этого Дустмурод просит кредит. К тому же Дустмурод дальновидный человек. Он знает, что скоро люди будут делать большие покупки по приближении большого праздника Нового года. Поэтому Дустмурод хочет закупить большой и широкий ассортимент продуктов питания для развития бизнеса и увеличения продаж. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Dustmurod is a young man of 26 who lives in the Rudaki region.  He has had his own business for 10 years now.  Dustmurod has his own store where he sells groceries.  He sells food products like fruit and vegetables and he values this business, as it allows him to provide for his family - his wife, two children and his parents.  He is the main breadwinner in his family, and now he needs to increase his assortment of goods for sale in his shop.  To do this, Dustmurod needs a loan.  He is a long-term thinker and he knows that he will soon need to buy some goods for the upcoming New Year's holiday.  Because of this, Dustmurod wants to buy a wide assortment of products to increase his business and improve his sales.  He is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy produce for his store to increase his business

loans.name: Jenine

texts.en:
Jenine is 35-years-old and single.

Jenine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Jenine has borrowed and paid five loans from Kiva partner NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from retailing electronic mobile load.

Jenine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell  for her buy and sell dried fish and spice business.

Leonida has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is a woman who always tries to find a source of income and improve their standard of living. She is 27-years-old. She is married and has two children. 

For more than eight years, Farogat has been busy with sewing national women dresses. She has her own workshop where she serves her customers. She manages the business alone and that's why she works hard from early morning till late evening. Farogat earns additional income from selling milk as she has some cows.  She wants to increase her working capital and maximize profits. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread, needles, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread and needles to increase working capital.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a 49-year-old man from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is married with three children.  He catches and sells fish to help augment the income of their household and to earn for a living. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as lead weights, hooks and fishing nets in order to improve his catch and increase his sales.

In the future, Eduardo hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as lead weights, hooks and fishing nets.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence used the previous loan to buy a pressing machine to ease her work and she says her level of output has now increased. She is a 62-year-old, hardworking woman with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been running a confectionery business since 1995, which she started with the aim of earning a living and paying school fees for her children. Florence is serving a number of customers including schools, supermarkets, and the general markets with a variety of eats. She is facing a challenge of unreliable workers and high labor turn over. Besides that, she desires to expand her business to new areas. Florence is requesting a loan to buy firewood, wheat, cooking oil and a packaging machine.

loans.use: to buy firewood,wheat,cooking oil and the packaging machine.

loans.name: Nestora

texts.en:
Nestora is 54 years old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nestora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, spices, etc.

Nestora has been in this business for two years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, spices, etc

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Marlyn has been in this business for 10 years. Marlyn earns additional income from selling fruit and charcoal.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nannet

texts.en:
Nannet works hard to support her family. Nannet is married and has a buy and sell nestle products business in the Philippines.

Nannet has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional boxes of nestle products to sell.

Nannet has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nannet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of nestle products to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
David, disfruta de su familia que está integrada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, viven todos juntos, sobre el recae toda la responsabilidad de cubrir los gastos de su hogar, David tiene una carpintería donde pone en práctica lo que aprendió de un amigo, pero que en la actualidad lo realiza de manera independiente. No se le ha dificultado el manejo de dicho negocio.
Con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de clavos, barniz, brocas, pegamento entre otros accesorios, que necesita para trabajar los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. Espera cumplir con las entregas de muebles en un corto plazo, generar más ingresos, cancelar la deuda y seguir equipando el negocio para tener más clientes satisfechos.
Sueña con mejorar la calidad de alimentación salud y educación de su familia, también le con generar empleo a otras carpinteros que al igual que el luchan por salir adelante.
texts.en:
David enjoys his family, which comprises his wife and three children. They all live together and all of the responsibility of paying the expenses falls on his shoulders. David is a carpenter and puts in practice all that he learned from a friend; he currently works independently. He has had no trouble managing his business.

He will invest the loan in nails, varnish, drill bits and glue, among other tools he needs to work on the orders he's received from his clients. He hopes to fulfill all of his furniture orders in a short time to generate more income, pay off the loan and continue equipping his business in order to satisfy his clients.

He dreams of providing his family with better nutrition, health and education; he also hopes to generate employment for other carpenters who, like him, struggle to get ahead.

loans.use: buy nails, varnish, drill bits and glue.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, she is 29-years-old from Waterloo2 in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children.  In 2012, Aminata established her wood business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase bags of wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to open a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is 36 years old and married, with two children. He completed high school in 1998 and obtained a diploma in teaching. He resigned as a teacher because the income was not enough to sustain him and his family.

He operates a grocery store and sells Coca-Cola products to customers in his hometown of Zimba. Adrian has been running his business for 11 years now. The income from this business is very important to him and his family, as it helps cover basic needs. 

He enjoys running his business because it gives him the opportunity to interact with other business owners in his hometown and earn a decent living.

Adrian has applied for a Kiva loan to add to his drink stock. He will use the money to order more crates of soft drinks. This will improve his overall volume of soda, and he will be able to sell more product, therefore improving his profit margins. 

He would like to thank Kiva and the Kiva lenders for the opportunity they have provided him to grow his business and improve his and his family's life.

loans.use: To order more drinks so he can increase his stock and earn more profits

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: “MUJERES EMPRESARIAS” es uno de los grupos que está conformada por socias muy responsables en sus cuotas y quienes se encuentran muy contentas por estar pasando el 07 ciclo. Elvira tiene 24 años es conviviente con 02  hijos. Elvira se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa de catálogos ya hace  03 años. Años atrás se dedicaba a trabajar como digitadora y sacando copias de libros. Sus productos son expendidos a sus vecinos y conocidos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos que estén en oferta  como perfumes shampoo  para bebes y lentes de sol y de esa manera obtendrá buenas sus ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Elvira es la segunda persona parada del izquierdo viste polera negra.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Empresarias" is a group composed of members who are very responsible with their repayments and who are very happy to enter their seventh loan cycle. 

Elvira is 24 years old, and lives with her partner and 2 children. Elvira has been selling beauty products and catalogue clothing for 3 years. Several years ago, she worked as a typist and made copies of books. Her products are sold to her neighbors and acquaintances. She will invest this loan in the purchase of products that she sells, like perfumes, baby shampoo, and sunglasses, and thus will be able to increase her earnings. 

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Elvira is the second person from the left, standing and wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, children's shampoo, and sunglasses

loans.name: Nursoat

texts.ru: Нурсоату 30 лет. Он женатый мужчина. У него есть дети. Дети Нурсоата уже ходят в школу. Нурсоат работает и старается обеспечить свою семью, чтобы они не в чем, не нуждались. Нурсоат пытается работать еще больше, чтобы получить больше дохода и дать своим детям необходимое образование. Дети растут и растут их потребности. И Нурсоат решил расширить свою деятельность. Он занимается животноводством. У него имеется два скота, которых вы видите на фотографии. Нурсоат хочет увеличить поголовья скота. Тогда увеличиться его деятельность. Чтобы купить необходимое количество скотов Нурсоату не хватает средств, поэтому он просит кредит. Нусоат надеется, что ему помогут и поддержат.
texts.en: Nurosat is 30 years old and he is married with children who are already in school.  He works and tries to take care of his family so they won't go without.  He is trying to work harder to make a better income and to give his children the education they need.  His children are growing and their needs are growing right along with them.  Nurosat has decided to expand his business by raising livestock.  He has two cows that you can see in the picture.  He wants to increase his head of livestock, then he wants to expand his business.  Nurosat needs money to buy the number of livestock he needs, which is why he is asking for a loan.  He is hoping that you will help and support him.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима 38-летняя замужняя женщина, имеет двух сыновей и дочь. Все ее дети учатся в школе. Муж Рахимы работает в чужой стране, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Рахима тоже зарабатывает на жизнь. Она вот уже пять лет как занимается выращиванием бычков и телят. Рахима обычно откармливает скот в течение месяца и затем перепродает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Для развития своего бизнеса Рахима нуждается в кредите. Она просит кредит чтобы закупить пару бычков и телят и увеличить поголовье скота. Прибыль она хочет потратить на улучшение условий жизни своей семьи.
texts.en:
Rahima is a 38-year-old married woman with two sons and a daughter. All of her children are in school. Rahima's husband works in a foreign country in order to support the family. Rahima also earns a living. For five years already, she has been involved in raising steers and calves. Rahima usually fattens cattle over the course of a month and then resells them at a premium in the livestock market.

To develop her business, Rahima needs a loan. She is requesting a loan to buy a pair of steers and calves and to increase her count of cattle. She wants to spend the profit on improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase steers and calves for increasing her headcount of cattle

loans.name: Jalolidin

texts.en:
Jalolidin was born in 1959. He lives with his wife and three children in the southern part of Tajikistan. He has been busy with animal husbandry. Jalolidin has no other source of income. 


He makes a little income, and that’s why he lives poor with his family. His children help him with fattening the cattle. Jalolidin feeds the cattle for six months and then sells them in the local market. 


He has great experience in this field. Thanks to his experience, he manages the business successfully. 


He is asking for a loan to buy cattle for increasing his working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing his working capital.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela de 48 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad. Es originaria de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. En sus  ratos libre de gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos y familiares, ella de caracteriza por ser responsables, trabajadora con ganas de superación personal.

Gracia a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos naturista para la salud. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto desde hace tres años. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra y venta de medicamentos y batidos naturista para la salud.  Ángela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ángela, 48 years old, is married with two adult children. She comes from Jinotepe, located in the northern zone of the country. En her free time, she enjoys the company of her children and family members. She is known for being responsible and hard-working with a desire for self-improvement. 

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she sells natural health products. She dedicates herself to her business around 10 hours per day, and has done this work happily for three years. Her business is located at a specific place in her locality. 

Her goal for this loan is to invest in the purchase and sale of natural health medications and drinks. Ángela is grateful for the support provided by Kiva lenders to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, to be able to have a means of decent work.
