loans.use: to invest in capital and stock her business, buying and selling natural products such as homeopathic medicines and drinks

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a 60-year-old widowed woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She primarily does farming. She toils on the land and grows rice. 


Her farming business started more than 20 years ago. Aside from farming, she also sells candles to help augment the income of their household. 


She is asking for a loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings, and also more candles.


In the future, Caridad hopes to expand both her businesses and increase business profitability in order to augment her income and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings, and to also buy more candles.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of fish needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan in order to buy additional stock of fish needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a better standard of living. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 49-years-old and supports six people in his family including his wife. He is married and together with his spouse they are blessed with five children. He runs a retail shop and has been in this business for five years now.

He will be using the loan to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and rice to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to complete the construction of his house. This is his third term loan and he paid his previous loans successfully. 

Joseph's future hopes are to grow his retail shop to a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.


She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.


Delia dreams that her business will continue to exist and hopes to have a better living. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Noami

texts.en: Noami is 49 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Noami is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers’ salaries during the harvest.  Noami has been farming sugarcane for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries during the harvest.

loans.name: Grace Jolly

texts.en:
Grace Jolly is a hardworking woman with two children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She offers decoration services and has been in service since 2007.  A good mother that she is,she desires to educate her children up to the University and set up sustainable income generating activities to secure their future.  The high cost of fuel and customers not paying on time pose a challenge to her business growth while her desire is to set up an events management company since she has vast experience.  Her personal goal is to build a good residential house.

Grace Jolly intends to use the loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand and bricks for construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement,sand and bricks for construction of her house.

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es:
José, opta por otro crédito ya que con el que se le dio anteriormente obtuvo una cosecha abundante, granos de calidad, tuvo mejores ventas de granos y ropa, su economía mejoro ha incluyo la venta de ropa y pudo cancelar las cuotas del crédito, también las condiciones de vida de su familia han mejorado mucho.
En está ocasión invertirá en el pago de mano de obra para la limpia y compra de ropa para dama y caballeros, con lo que surtirá el negocio y mantendrá la fidelidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is opting for another loan, since with the one he was given previously, he obtained an abundant harvest with quality grain, and he had better sales of grain and clothing. His economy, which included the sale of clothing, improved, and he was able to make the loan payments. In addition, the living conditions of his family have improved a lot.

This time he will invest in paying for labor to clean [his fields] and buy clothing for women and men, with which he will stock his business and maintain the loyalty of his customers.

loans.use: to pay for labor to clean his fields and buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married mother of two children going to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, and maize flour from her home to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Halim

texts.en: Halim is 29 years old, married and has children who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Halim's business is a grocery store where he offers stable prices for his clients. He is a very hardworking and kind person. He is happy about attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demands is hindering his business progress and growth. So, he took a second loan of 350,000 YER in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.  He is grateful to Kiva lenders for funding the first loan.

loans.use: in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es una persona de 46 años de edad, soltero.  Por razones de la vida viajo buscando un mejor futuro para su esposa y estando fuera del país, decidieron separarse, desde entonces vive solo con sus hermanos en la misma casa.  Se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y trabajos jornales de donde tiene sus ingresos para sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus hermanos en los gastos de la vivienda, que es donde solo hace un aporte; porque solo fuera pasa trabajando y esa es toda su familia que él tiene, porque nunca pudo formar su propio hogar.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura, desde que tenía la edad de 10 años, inicio trabajando como corralero en las haciendas que existían antes andaba con ganado y realizaba trabajos en los cultivos de maíz en todo lo de la agricultura. Toda la vida esa ha sido la actividad, a la cual sea dedicado y gracias a eso tiene mucha experiencia en lo de maíz y frijol que son los cultivos que produce; todo esto lo aprendió de una manera obligado porque sus padres siempre les obligaban al trabajo no los dejaban asistir a la escuela como hoy manifiesta el cliente. A parte de la agricultura, se dedica a  hacer trabajos de jornal y también en la producción de maíz trabajan en conjunto con su otro hermano y la distancia que recorren para llegar al campo es de 45 minutos en bicicleta, que dice venir rendido cuando llega a casa, porque su trabajo lo realiza todo el día de 6 a 5 de la tarde.

El dinero lo solicito para realizar, los pagos de mosos que pondrá a cosechar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y esto porque quiere salir con los primeros granos en el mes de enero donde aún se mantiene a un buen precio. Con el dinero, podrá cubrir la necesidad de sacar sus granos con mucha mayor rapidez y facilidades y menos trabajo para él y su hermano.

Él piensa que con las ganancias de su producción, poder ayudar a su sobrino; ya que es como un hijo el que nunca pudo tener y con lágrimas en los ojos el cliente lamenta grandemente nunca haber podido tener su propia familia y tener el apoyo de su esposa aunque sus hermanos lo apoyen, pero no es igual. Poro tiene fe en Dios, que su condición de vida mejorara y poder vivir de una manera con menos trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old, and he is single. For reasons of life, he traveled to look for a better future for his wife, and since he was out of the country, they decided to separate. Since then, he lives unaccompanied, in the same house as his siblings. He works in agriculture and also as a day laborer, from which he has income for his personal expenses and to help his siblings with the household expenses, which is his main contribution, because he spends all his time working. This is all the family that he has, because he was never able to have his own family.

Juan has worked in agriculture since the age of 10. He began working as a ranch hand on the ranches that existed in the past. He worked with cattle and did work in the corn fields in everything related to agriculture. His whole life has been this work, and thanks to this he has a lot of experience with corn and beans, which are the crops he produces. He was obliged to learn all this because his parents always required them to work. They did not let them go to school, as he states now. In addition to agriculture, he works as a day laborer and also in the production of corn. He works together with his other brother and the distance that they travel to arrive at the field is about 45 minutes by bicycle, which is to say that he is worn out when he arrives at the house, because he does his work all day from 6 [in the morning] until 5 in the afternoon.

He is applying for the loan to pay the workers who will harvest 21,000 square meters of corn, because he wants to appear with the first grains in the month of January when the price is still good. With the money, he will be able to cover the need to harvest his grain much more rapidly and easily and with less work for him and his brother.

He thinks that with the earnings from his production, he will be able to help his nephew, since he is like the son that he was never able to have. With tears in his eyes, the borrower greatly laments that he was never able to have his own family and have the support of his wife, although his siblings help him, but it's not the same. But he has faith in God that his condition in life will improve and he will be able to live in a way that requires less work.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Hamro

texts.ru: Хамро начинает прибыльный бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Ему 47 лет. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Шахритус, где сам климат и природа благоприятствует ведению этого вида деятельности. Хамро в данный момент занимается растениеводством и еще работает в хлопкоочистительном заводе. Он накопил сбережение в размере 450 долларов для начала новой деятельности. К тому же у него имеется коровник при дворе дома. Хамро запрашивает кредит в размере 1900 долларов США. Он планирует купить 4 голов бычков, откармливать их в течение 35-40 дней и затем продавать с наценкой на местном скотном рынке. Хамро начинает этот бизнес, чтобы иметь еще один дополнительный источник дохода и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Hamro is starting a business fattening and selling cows and bulls.  He is 47 years old and he lives with his family in the Shahrituz region, where the climate and nature suit this kind of business.  At the moment, Hamro is an agricultural worker and he also works at a cotton processing factory.  He has saved up $450 to start his business and he also has a cow shed next to his house.  Hamro is asking for a loan of $1,900 so he can buy 4 bulls to fatten up in the course of 30-45 days and sell on for a profit at the local cattle market.  He is starting this business so he can have another source of income to improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy four bulls to start his business raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Жители районов и сел Таджикистана, в том числе района Шахритуса в основном занимаются животноводством и земледелием. В течение нескольких лет Сафарали занимался земледелием, но недавно начал деятельность скотоводства.  Ему понравилось работать на скотном дворе, и у него было немного опыта, которого получил от своего отца. Деятельность животноводства для Сафарали оказалось прибыльным и удобным. Он может работать у себя дома. 
   Сафарали решил расширить свою деятельность и приобрести больше скотов, но достаточной суммы у него не оказалось, по этой причине он просит кредит. На сумму кредита он купит пару голов скота, и увеличить свою деятельность. Сафарали верит и надеется на Вашу помощь. Ведь мир не без добрых людей!
texts.en:
The residents of the countryside and villages of Tajikistan, and specifically in the Shahrituz region, are mainly engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture. Over the course of several years, Safarali has been engaged in agriculture, but recently he began livestock activities. He liked to work in the cattle yard, and he had a bit of experience which he received from his father. Livestock activities for Safarali have turned out profitable and convenient. He is able to work at his own home.

Safarali decided to expand his activities and to purchase more cattle, but he did not have a sufficient sum and for this reason he is requesting a loan. With the loan amount, he will buy a pair of cattle and increase his activities.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of cattle and to expand his activities

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely de 42 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad de 16,10 anos los cuales está estudiando. Es originaria de Jinotepe y se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía d sus hijos. Les prepara comida típica como “nacatamal” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y lucha día a día para cumplir sus objetivos y metas y sueños como poder forma a sus hijos, y que tenga mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica el servicio de salón de belleza el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 18  años que desempeña dicha actividad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en materia prima para brindar el servicio de salón de belleza como tintes, crema alisadora, pinturas de ullas, limas, crema anti friz, aceite para el cabello.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su servicio. Aracely agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Aracely, who is 42 years old, is a single mother with two minor children, ages 16 and 10, who are in school. She is originally from Jinotepe and is characterized as hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. In her free time she likes to enjoy the companionship of her children. She prepares them typical food such as nactamales (Nicaraguan tamales). Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources, she was not able to study for a career, and she strives every day to accomplish her objectives, goals and dreams, such as training her children so that they have better opportunities in life.

Thanks to her efforts and her will to advance, she has had a business, a beauty salon located in her home, for 16 years, and there she offers beauty services. The purpose of the loan is to invest in basic supplies to offer beauty salon services, such as colorings, straightening creams, nail polishes, nail files, anti-frizz creams, and hair oil. She works in her business some 10 hours a day, offering her services. Aracely is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business with beauty products such as colorings, straightening creams, nail polishes, nail files, anti-frizz cream, and hair oils

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all currently in school. 

For the past six years, Daisy has been working hard to manage her electronics shop, which sells TVs, extensions, remotes, sockets, antennas, and cables. 

To help expand her business, Daisy has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bigger quantities of electronics like TVs, extensions, remotes, sockets, antennas, and cables.  It will help Daisy to generate greater profits and pay her children school fees so she will be able to educate her children up to the higher level. 

Daisy hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Daisy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Daisy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of electronics like TVs, extensions, remotes, sockets, antennas, and cables

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 42 years old and a hard-working man, with seven children.  He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a farmer who grows a variety of crops but also does carpentry work to raise money to support his family.

Like most farmers, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and by inadequate capital to venture into modern farming, while his desire is to buy more land for farming and to diversify his business to include stone quarrying, which is a lucrative activity in his area.

Amos is requesting a loan to pay workers who are quarrying stones for him to sell.

loans.use: to pay workers who are quarrying stones for him to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 45 years old and a widow, with two children, both in school.   She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Raquel has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like spices, vegetables, fish, meats, etc.

Raquel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, like spices, vegetables, fish, meats, etc

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 47 years of age, a resident of a Kampala suburb, married with 4 children who all attend school.  Juliet has looked after her sister's son after she passed three years ago.

Juliet operates a boutique, which is situated in Mengo town, mainly dealing in ladies clothes.  She started this business in 2003 when she realized that her family responsibilities where increasing rapidly, yet her husband’s income was not enough to support the entire family.  So she basically started the business to help meet the growing demands of the family.

Juliet first borrowed a loan with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) to pay college tuition for her sister’s son who is currently in his final year at Makerere University.  She is very grateful to the funders who have enabled her to educate her sister's son since his first year at University. 

Juliet needs a loan to further cater for the other children's education.

loans.use: for school fees.

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi is a hardworking man living in Hoima,Uganda.  He is a mechanic who repairs all kinds of vehicles, and with the proceeds he has been able to start a spare parts business.  He has been in business since 2006.

Customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the high demand poses a challenge to his business growth.  His dream is to set up a modern garage in town.

Abasi intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ruhshona

texts.en:
Ruhshona is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. She is 25 years old, single and lives with her parents and brother. They live together happy in the village which is located in the South part of Tajikistan. 

Ruhshona doesn't have a higher education.  She has been busy with her own business sells fruit in a local market.  She buys wholesale from farmers and retails her items in a local market. 

Ruhshona’s brother is going to married but they have not money for a wedding party.  Ruhshona is asking for a loan to pay for a wedding party for her brother. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for a wedding party for her brother.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, trabaja como agricultor en su pequeña parcela, con mucho esfuerzo Jorge lleva 10 años trabajando en esta actividad y gracias a ello ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo, así el podrá tener una mejor cosecha y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the city of Pucallpa. He works with great effort as a farmer on his small parcel of land. Jorge has been doing this work for 10 years, and thanks to this he has been able to raise his family.

Jorge is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy compost, fertilizer, and other items to maintain his plantings. Thus he will be able to have a better harvest and continue striving to be able to make a reality of his great dream: to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer, among other items

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
This is Meriam. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result more profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs.  Meriam looks forward to receiving another loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Meriam hopes that her business will grow bigger and that she will have more customers.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 31 year old married man with three children aged 7, 4 and 1 who live in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His main business is transport; the business he started with a vision of becoming self reliant. He faces challenges of unpredictable weather, a poor road network and high fuel costs, however he has a vision of building is own home and rental houses and owning at least four motorcycles.

Victor intends to use the loan to buy sand and cement for plastering his residential house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement for plastering his residential house.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and feed for her livestock.

Antonieta has been raising livestock for three years and she also earns additional income from furniture making.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and feeds for her livestock.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming sugar cane.  Arlene is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase materials like thread, fabrics, needle, etc. for her tailoring business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities with 21 previous loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, fabrics, needle, etc. for tailoring.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 73 years old and a widow with one child.

Vicenta works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, shampoo, sugar, milk, egg, can goods, etc.

Vicenta has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Vicenta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, sugar, milk, egg, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah has sold fruits and vegetables selling business and operated a food vending business to supplement her income.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby.  Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

With a Ksh 30,000 loan, Jedidah wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to resell . 

Jedidah decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard, and she appreciates your support,

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rasol's Group

texts.en:
Rasol is a 25 years old and a hard-working, ambitious Iraqi man. In line with cultural and traditional practices, as a yet-unmarried man he is living with his family.  

To generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of his family, he is working hard as a vegetable and fruit salesman. He started his little shop two years ago.

A typical way to sell fruits and vegetables in his area is by driving around in the neighborhood, selling his goods on the street, near the homes of his customers. Every morning the streets of neighborhoods are noisy from the horns of such moving stalls, as women shop for the daily fresh goods for that day’s lunch and dinner. 

Rasol would like to buy a small vehicle, a 3-wheeled motorcycle with a platform on the back, typical for delivering and selling vegetables so he can participate in this mode of selling and increase his sales by going into the areas where customers are ready to buy. 

To be able to make the purchase he is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

As all the members of this group are under the age of 30 - with ages 25, 28, and 18 - the group qualifies for a "youth loan."

loans.use: to buy a small vehicle to transport his goods to his customers

loans.name: Jabeen's Group

texts.en:
Jabeen is 31 years old, a married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional.

For this reason, Jabeen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Jabeen says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his three-wheeled rickshaw

loans.name: Edelma Patricia

texts.es: Doña Edelma tiene 48 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Jalapa. Casada y madre de dos hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio profesora, se dedica con mucho esmero a la enseñanza, el cual con entusiasmo, ha logrado salir adelante. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones de la red de saneamiento de su domicilio. Solicita el crédito para mejorar el saneamiento de su vivienda, con el fin de tener un hogar higiénico y seguro. Estima que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda para tener cada día una mejor forma de vivir.
texts.en: Doña Edelma is 48 years old. She is originally from the city of Jalapa. She is married and is the mother of two children, who are already independent. She is a teacher. She puts great effort and enthusiasm into teaching, and with this she has been able to succeed. Her next goal is to improve the conditions of the sewage system in her home. She is applying for the loan to improve the sewage system of her residence, with the goal of having a hygienic and safe dwelling. She feels that this loan will help her a lot, since she will be able to improve her quality of life. Her future plan is to continue improving the conditions of her home to have a better and better form of living.

loans.use: to improve the sanitation system of her house.

loans.name: Hikoyatmo

texts.ru:
Хикоятмо 43 летняя жительница района Хамадони. Она мама двоих сыновей. Старший сын Хикоятмо находится в городе Душанбе. Там он работает строителем. Младший сын живет с ней. Хикоятмо развелась с мужем, и она с сыном живет одна. 
   Хикоятмо около 6 лет работает секретарем в государственном учреждении. Она в свободное от работы время она проводит на скотном дворе. Она любит животных. И просит кредит, чтобы купить корову для личных нужд. У нее есть один бык. Хикоятмо хочет купить корову, чтобы она обеспечила ее семью молоком. После приобретения коровы Хикоятмо не будет тратить свое время по напрасному и будет ухаживать за своими скотами. Хикоятмо надеется, что она сможет купить корову.
texts.en:
Hikoyatmo is 43 years old and lives in the Hamadoni region. She is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is presently in the city of Dushanbe, where he works in construction. Her youngest son lives with her. Hikoyatma is divorced from her husband, and lives by herself with her son.
For over six years, Hikoyatma has been working as a secretary in a state agency. In her free time, she works on an animal farm. She loves animals. She is requesting a loan in order to buy her own cow. SHe already owns a bull. Hikoyatma would like to buy a cow so as to provide her family with milk. After buying a cow, Hikoyatma will waste no time in taking care of her livestock. Hikoyatam hopes that it will be possible for her to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the region of kampala, south in Uganda.  He is Married and has four children with three of them currently in school.  For the past eight years, Tonny has worked hard to manage his retail shop,  He sells home made products like bread, sugar, salt, posho, sweets and juice. 

To help expand his business, Tonny has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread, sugar, salt, posho, sweets and juice to generate greater profits and improve his family. Tonny hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Tonny is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tonny who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.


"

loans.use: to buy more bread, sugar, salt, posho, sweets, juice and other items.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a native woman from the town of Alicia, Bohol. She is married with 3 school aged children. Leonora runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells items ranging from sugar, coffee, noodles,shampoo, cooking oil, soap and various snack foods. 

Leonora is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like biscuits, noodles, snack foods, beverages and canned goods, to cater the needs of her customers, as well as maintain the inventory of her store.

In the future, Leonora hopes to expand her business and increase her profits so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like biscuits, noodles, snack foods, beverages and canned goods,

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
This is Gilda. She previously accessed a 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Gilda would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gilda dreams to have a "One Stop Shop Store" and hopes that her family will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products (such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics) needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Berlinda requests a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like banana, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Berlinda has been in business for 11 years.

In the future, Berlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like banana, sugar, cooking oil, etc,

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Marilyn earns more income from retailing electronic mobile load.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computers and payment for the electric bill for her internet cafe business. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computers and payment for the electric bill for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Members of this group request to remain anonymous on the Kiva website.

The lead member of this group is a 23 years old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income to help support her family.

She has five years of experience making dresses for women and children and also making small household fabric items, based on her customers’ needs. Her small, income generating activity, based in her home, allows her to be flexible with the household duties as well as with the orders received from clients. 

A major obstacle, however, is that her electrical power is not reliable, frequently cutting off for hours with no regular pattern or predictability.  This makes planning her work difficult, and also leaves her little time to compete her actual work orders. To better plan the work and deliver higher quality services, she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.  To be able to afford the purchases, she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

------------------------

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Samira's Group

texts.en:
Samira is a 32-year-old married Iraqi woman. She is the mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Samira is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 10 years of experience with making dresses for women and children and also making small household items from fabric based on her customers’ needs. The small, income generating activity based in her home allows her to be flexible with her household duties as well as with the orders received from her clients. A major obstacle, however, is the fact that in her area power outages are frequent and can last for many hours, with no regular patterns or predictability. This makes planning the work difficult, and also leaves her little time for the actual orders to be completed. To be able to better plan the work and deliver better quality services she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to afford the purchases she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Nadima's Group

texts.en:
Nadima is 50 years old. She is an Iraqi woman, married, and a mother of six children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nadima is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

While she learned her sewing skills at a young age, as an income generating activity she only started her small business activity relatively recently. She has 10 years of experience with making dresses for women and children and also making small fabric household items based on her customers’ needs. The small income generating activity based in her home allows her to be flexible with the household duties as well as with the orders received from the clients. A major obstacle, however, is the fact that in her area power cuts are frequent and can last for many hours, with no regular patterns or predictability. This makes planning the work difficult, and also leaves her little time for the actual orders to be completed. To be able to better plan the work and deliver better quality services, she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to afford the purchases she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 34-year-old hardworking woman with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells secondhand shoes and clothes to earn a living. She started the business in order to raise money to support her family. Since she operates in the open, weather changes affect her business growth while her dream is to own a modern boutique in town that keeps up with the trends. Jackline intends to use the loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 28 years old. She is a young married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Fatma is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Despite her young age, she has many years of experience making dresses for women and children and also making small household items out of fabric based on her customers’ needs. The small, income generating activity based in her home allows her to be flexible with her household duties as well as with the orders received from her clients. A major obstacle, however, is the fact that in her area power outages are frequent and can last for many hours, with no regular patterns or predictability. This makes planning the work difficult, and also leaves her little time for the actual orders to be completed. To be able to better plan the work and deliver better quality services she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to afford the purchases she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Исмоил хочет получить повторный кредит для приобретения техники и оборудования, чтобы увеличить ассортимент блюда. Первый кредит, который он получил, он использовал для ремонта столовой. 
На сегодняшний день Исмоил улучшил условия в столовой. Он продолжает свой бизнес. С помощью хороших людей, Кредиторов Кива и сайта Кива, которые его поддержали три года назад он успешно продолжает свое дело. Сейчас ему необходимо увеличить ассортимент блюд. И для этого ему срочно нужно приобрести технику и оборудования. Он ждет от Вас поддержки. :)
texts.en:
Ismoil would like to obtain a new loan in order to buy the necessary electrics and tool in order to expand the choices on his menu. His first loan was used to renovate his cafe.

Ismoil has made improvements to his physical space. He  continues to work in his business. Thanks to good people--the lenders on the Kiva site who supported him three years ago--he is successful at managing his business. At present he needs to expand  the choices of food served. This is why he needs to purchase electrics and equipment right away. He is counting on your help :).

loans.use: to buy electrics and equipment [for his cafe].

loans.name: Rustamkhon

texts.ru: Рустамхону 55 лет. Он имеет свой малый прибыльный бизнес, благодаря которому он обеспечивает свою большую семью, которая состоит из его жены, четверо сыновей, двух дочерей, двух внуков и невестки. В их семье работают только он и двое его старших сыновей. Около 10 лет Рустамхон  предоставляет услуги по аренде столов, стульев и посуды. Он дает возможность жителям своего района Хамадони брать у него в аренду столы, стулья, посуду для проведения ими свадеб и других мероприятий. Рустам ведет свой бизнес в маленьком арендованном магазине уже несколько лет.  Так как он по натуре целеустремленный человек, сейчас он решил расширить свой бизнес. Его главная цель иметь собственный магазин. Он больше не хочет арендовать магазин, так как у него на это уходит большая сумма. Чтобы осуществить задуманное Рустамхону не хватает собственных средств, поэтому он запрашивает кредит. Рустамхон хочет приобрести просторное помещение и использовать его в качестве своего магазина, где он будет продолжать предоставлять свои услуги. Он уже выбрал подходящее помещение, осталось только внести оплату и подготовить документы на собственность. Рустамхон очень нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Rustamkhon is 55 years old. He has his own small business, which brings in a profit helping him to support his large family consisting of his wife, four sons, two daughters, two grandchildren and a daughter-in-law. In his family, only Rustamkhon and two of his elder sons are earning an income. For over 10 years, Rustamhkon has been providing a service renting out tables, chairs and plates. He makes it possible for residents of the Khamadoni region to rent tables, chair, plates for weddings and other events. Rustam has been working out of a small leased space for several years. Since he is a goal-oriented person by nature, he has decided to expand his business. His main goal is to own his proper store. He does not want to continue leasing space as this requires a lot of money. Rustamkhon lacks own funds in order to realize this plan, which is why he is applying for a loan. Rustamkhon would like to purchase a spacious store and use it to provide his services. He has already picked a suitable property; he just needs to make a payment and prepare the documents for the property transfer. Rustamkhon truly needs this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a store and expand his business.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: Los socios(as) del grupo “VIRGEN DE LA PUERTA” se encuentra muy contentos por encontrarse pasando el 11 ciclo. Juliana tiene 55 años es soltera con 03 hijos independientes y uno educando. Hace 36 años se dedica a la venta de utensilios domésticos y accesorios de dormitorio en forma ambulatoria. Años atrás se dedicaba a servicios domestico. Es de esta manera que ha podido ser madre y padre para su hijo. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios de dormitorios como sabanas de estación de verano, pijamas para niños y adultos. Su mayor deseo es comprar un stand en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Juliana es la que se encuentra en medio de las personas paradas viste chompa morado.
texts.en: The members of the communal bank “Virgen de la Puerta” are happy because they’ve completed their 11th loan cycle. Juliana is 55 years old. She’s single with three grown children and one in school. She’s been selling household utensils and bedroom accessories for 36 years. In years past she did domestic labor. This was how she could be both mother and father to her son. She will invest this loan in the purchase of bedroom accessories like sheets for summer and pajamas for children and adults. Her greater goal is to buy a stand where she can sell her products. The group is very grateful for the Kiva lenders for the loan they’ve offered. Juliana is in the middle of the people who are standing and wearing purple sweater dress.

loans.use: to buy summer sheets and pajamas.

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
This is Edmun, 40, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. His partner is Elean, a housewife and together they have children. They manage their household and operate a business.  At this time, Edmun is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edmun maintains a tricycle business. He owned and drives one motorcycle with sidecar (tricycle) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working as early as 7:00am in the morning until 8:00pm in the evening.  His regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Edmun earns a minimum of Php300 every day.

To help Edmun continue operating his business, he is requesting an amount of Php10, 000 to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his taxi. He has to maintain his taxi in good condition in order to earn a regular income. 

Edmun hopes to have additional tricycles and he dreams that his family will always be in good health.  He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain his tricycle taxi.

loans.name: Mirna Haydee

texts.es:
Mirna, es una mujer viuda, que sola saca adelante a sus hijos a pesar de la gran responsabilidad que eso significa ella no ha desmayado en luchar por darles lo necesario. Se dedica a vender productos de belleza, articulos por catalogos y además posee una pequeña tienda, este negocio lo emprendió debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos luego que su esposo falleciera. No ha sido dificultad para ella atender estas actividades.
Invertirá en la compra de cremas corporales, labiales, bebidas, azúcar, arroz y frijol,  con lo que surtirá el negocio y dará una mejor atención a sus clientes, espera atraer más clientes, aumentar sus ventas, incrementar sus ganancias y solventar sus compromisos económicos.
Aspira a tener un negocio más grande que sea muy competitivo para que le de todos los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su familia y patrocinarles una educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna is a widow who supports her kids on her own in spite of the great burden which means that she doesn’t shy away from working hard to give them what they need. She sells beauty products from catalogues and also from a small store. She began this business because she needed to earn income after her husband died. It was not hard for her to do this. 

She will invest in the purchase of body lotion, lipstick, drinks, sugar, rice, and beans. She’ll supply her business with this and give her client’s better service. She’d like to attract more clients, increase her sales, increase her income, and meet her financial obligations. 

She’d like to have a bigger store that will be more competitive so that it will provide her with all the income she needs to cover the family’s basic costs and finance her children’s higher education.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, lipsticks, sugar, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by working at a general store.  Clarita is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, se decidió por otro préstamo para aprovechar la temporada navideña, en esta oportunidad comprara quesillo, carne, repollo y verduras, para surtir el inventario de su negocio y seguir ofreciendo un servicio de calidad a sus clientes en su pupuseria.
Con el préstamo anterior logro ampliar su negocio, sus ventas aumentaron, sus ganancias crecieron, hoy tiene una mejor economía que le permite dar mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara has decided to get another loan to take advantage of the holiday season. With this loan she will buy cheese, meat, cabbage, and vegetables to supply her business and continue offering quality service to her customers. 

She was able to grow her business with the previous loan. Her sales increased, and her profits grew. Today she’s better off financially which allows her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, meat, cabbage, and vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis, es un joven soltero de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres, en casa propia, es muy emprendedor por lo que el administra su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos y ganado, es un oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeño.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de dos terneros para engordarlos y luego venderlos, con esto el ampliara su negocio, tendrá mayores ventas y tendrá ingresos que le permitan poco a poco ir teniendo más ganado y cancelar las cuotas.
Sueña con mejorar su economía para apoyar a sus padres en los gastos de su hogar y tener un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Luis is a 20 year old single young man. He lives with his parents in his own home. He’s very enterprising as he runs a business growing basic grains and raising cattle. It’s a job he learned when he was little. 

He will invest the money into purchasing land to raise and later sell the cattle. This will he will grow his business, have more sales, and earn more income which will allow him to gradually acquire more cattle and make his payments.

He dreams of improving his financial situation to help his parents in paying household cost and to have a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy more land.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана уже пользовалась финансовой помощью КИВА. Постепенно развивает свой небольшой и удобный бизнес, реализуя качественные товары фирмы Эмвей, получая возможность сделать обновки в доме. 
В этот раз она обратилась за содействием КИВА в размере 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести оптовую партию бытовой химии, косметики и витаминов фирмы Эмвей под реализацию своим постоянным клиентам, которые стабильно берую у нее продукцию этой компании.
texts.en:
Oksana has already received financial support from Kiva in the past. She gradually expands her small and practical business by selling high-quality Amway goods. Thanks to this work she is able to make small renovations in her home.

This time she is applying for a Kiva loan in the amount of 8,000 UAH in order to buy Amway household cleaners, cosmetics and vitamins wholesale in order to sell these goods to her regular customers who  buy Amway products from her on an ongoing basis.

loans.use: to buy household products, cosmetics and vitamins from Amway.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия – из Хуста, торгует косметикой, красками для волос. Свой бизнес Наталия начала 2 года назад. Торговую площадь под бизнес она арендует. Наиболее популярной группой товаров их всех, которые Наталия предлагает своим покупателям, являются средства гигиены, которые всегда хорошо распродаются. 
Сумма в 30 000 гривен нужна Натальи для того, чтобы приобрести автомобиль для бизнеса. Наталия развозит товар в села, магазины и салоны красоты. Без транспортного средства просто не обойтись.
texts.en:
Nataliya lives in Khoost, Ukraine. She sells cosmetics and hair color. She launched her business two years ago. She leases her sales space. The most popular type of goods she offers to her customers are personal care items; they always sell well.

Nataliya needs 30,000 UAH in order to buy a car for  business purposes. She delivers her goods to various villages, to stores and beauty salons. It is simply impossible to manage without a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for business purposes.

loans.name: Farrukhruz

texts.ru: Фаррухрузу 26 лет. Он женатый молодой человек. У него есть двухлетняя дочка. Его дочка является для Фаррухруза стимулом для продвижения вперед и достижения новых целей. Фаррухруз ради своей семьи живет и работает. Он работает ювелиром. Фаррухруз только чинит и восстанавливает ювелирные изделия, но хочет расширить свои услуги. Фаррухруз просит взаймы для приобретения аппарата, чтобы создавать ювелирные изделия. Фаррухруз ответственный молодой человек и он не боится вставить перед собой новые цели. С помощью аппарата его работа будет больше и сложнее. Фаррухруз не боится трудностей. И смело идет к своей мечте.
texts.en: Farrukhruz is 26 years old and married. He has a two-year old daughter. His daughter is  what inspires him to move forward and reach for new goals. Farrukhruz works and lives for the sake of his family. He is a jeweler by trade. At present he only repairs and restores jewelry, but he would like to expand his services. Farrukhruz is requesting a loan in order to buy equipment for making jewelry. He is a responsible young man who has no fear of new goals. Thanks to the equipment, he will be able to perform more complex work. Farrukhruz does not shy away from challenges. He courageously pursues his dreams.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making jewelry.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Bena is 45 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the region of Kampala south in Uganda.  He has four children and one of them is currently in school. For the past three years, Bena has worked hard to manage his retail shop.  He sells bread,sugar, posho, sweets and other house items. 

To help expand his business, Bena has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more bread,sugar,posho,sweets and other items.  The loan will help Bena generate greater profits and enable him to restock his shop and hopefully help him meet the basic needs for his family.  Bena hopes that in the future he will be able to have one of the best business in the area. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bena who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.


"

loans.use: to purchase bread,sugar, posho, sweets,and other items.

loans.name: Abduzhalil

texts.en:
Abduzhalil is 39 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife and two children.  

The only source of income for the family is from animal husbandry.  It is hardly enough to provide food for his family.  Abduzhalil has been busy with his business for some years.  He developed his business little by little. He is the only feed keeper of his family. 

Abduzhalil wants to develop his business, but he has not money to buy more cattle.  This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and from his profit, improve his family's living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Milagritos

texts.es:
Milagritos tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha y para poder salir adelante trabaja en una pequeña empresa textil desde hace 8 años, Milagritos se esfuerza mucho cada día por realizar su trabajo de buena manera, es por ello cree que le va bien en su trabajo.

Milagritos esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y poder terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Milagritos is 38 years old. She lives in the city of Chincha. To be able to move forward in life she has worked in a small textile business for 8 years. Milagritos strengthens herself each day by doing her work well. It's for this reason that she believes her job is going well.

Milagritos is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help that they have provided she will be able to purchase construction materials to realize her grand dream: "Giving a profession to her daughter and being able to complete the construction on her home".

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old and has five children.  She is married and has one child who is in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines.  She requests a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been farming rice for 38 years, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

Elizabeth would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Myrna has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear items.

Myrna has sustained her business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and operates a general store in the Philippines.

Marilyn requests a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has been in this business for 1 year now.

Marilyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 28 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the  region of Kampala South in Uganda. She has no children. For the past five years, Anita has been working hard to manage her fish business. She deals in smoked fish in the market. 

To help expand her business, Anita has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fish, and will help Anita to generate greater profits and meet other personal family demands. Anita hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch in Salaama. 

Anita is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anita who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: Purchase more fish

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил 20 лет ведет свое собственное тепличное хозяйство. На 44 сотках земли он выращивает 7 000 кустов помидор, 4 500 кустов огурцов, которые потом реализует на рынках своей области. Михаил любит свое дело, с удовольствием занимается ведением сельского хозяйства. 
Михаил планирует построить две дополнительные теплицы, для чего ему необходима сумма в 30 000 гривен. За счет новых теплиц Михаил надеется расширить свой бизнес и получить дополнительную прибыль после реализации дополнительной сельскохозяйственной продукции.
texts.en: Mikhail has been growing vegetables in a greenhouse for 20 years. He has 4,440 square meters [1 acre] of land, where he grows 7,000 tomato plants and 4,500 cucumber plants. He sells his vegetables at the markets in his region. He likes his work and enjoys farming. Mikhail is planning to buy two additional greenhouses, for which he needs 30,000 UAH. Thanks to the new greenhouses, Mikhail hopes to expand his business and earn an additional revenue after selling the additional farm produce.

loans.use: to construct two additional greenhouses.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр уже 8 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством в селе Кардашинка. На 50 сотках в теплицах выращивает ранние и поздние помидоры, огурцы и пекинскую капусту. Александр
Александру нужны дополнительные средства в размере 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы купить удобрения, пленку, семена и дрова, а также сделать ремонт теплиц перед началом фермерского сезона. Вложив средства в тепличное хозяйство, Александо сможет получить доход с продажи ранних овощей, заработав на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en: Alexander has been growing vegetables in a greenhouse in the village of Kardashinka for eight years. He has 5,000 square meters [1.2 acres] of land, where he grows early and late tomatoes, cucumbers and Chinese cabbage . He needs 30,000 UAH in order to buy fertilizers,  plastic film, seeds and firewood, and also renovate his greenhouses before the beginning of the farm season. By investing  funds in his greenhouse business, Alexander will be able to earn an income by selling early vegetable varieties and provide for the needs of his family and business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, plastic film, wood and renovate some greenhouses.

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en:
Daisy Mae is 24 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Daisy Mae is borrowing 5,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Daisy Mae has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Possiano

texts.en: Possiano used his previous loan to buy a new motorcycle, and the business is very lucrative. In his business, he faces a problem of high fuel costs and high fees levied on him to be able to operate. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university level and to set up a number of sustainable income generating activities to secure his family’s future. Inadequate capital poses a challenge to his growth, while his dream is to venture into farming. Possiano will use this loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a hardworking married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in business for four years. With the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Ever changing customer preferences and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth, while her dreams are to own a modern boutique and diversify the business to include general merchandise. 

Zainabu intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 48-year-old married woman with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has a fresh food stall in the market, a business she has done for the last 12 years. With support from her husband, she has been able to grow her business. She plans on starting up a retail shop and educating her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Sarah is requesting a loan to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Neda's Group

texts.en:
Neda is a 41-year-old, married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Neda is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and to participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She has over 10 years of experience with making dresses for women and children and also making small fabric household items based on her customers’ needs. The small, income-generating activity based in her home allows her to be flexible with the household duties, as well as with the orders received from the clients. A major obstacle, however, is the fact that in her area power outages are frequent and can last for many hours, with no regular patterns or predictability. These outages make planning the work difficult and also leave her little time for the actual orders to be completed. To be able to better plan the work and to deliver better quality services, she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to afford the purchases, she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers “group loans” for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor and, therefore, unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders’ consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the region of Masaka in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer, soda, spirits, wine and water. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more beer, soda, spirits, and water for sale. This will help Teddy to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. Teddy hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a bigger bar. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more beer, soda, spirits, and water for sale

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as an ambitious person. He operates a retail store where he sells sugar, bread, salt, washing soap and other items. He describes his family challenge to be that water is very scarce in the area where he lives. 

He will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for her vehicle, and it was well maintained, too. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her child, while her income from business is supporting their everyday household income.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the vehicle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedita hopes to have another vehicle for business and dreams to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en: Benedicto is a married man from Talibon, Bohol. He operates a motorcycle service. He transports passengers from one place to another. He has been operating a motorcycle transport service for more than 10 years now. Benedicto is asking for a loan to buy spare parts such as a tire and nuts and bolts. With these parts, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his tricycle. In the future, Benedicto hopes to make his business stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as a tire and nuts and bolts.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as bamboo, nails, and paint for her bamboo furniture making business.

Irenea has been in this business for 12 years. Irenea earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Irenea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as bamboo, nails, and paint for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomato seeds.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 38-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, and he mainly sells phones and phone accessories. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy land for farming and to build a residential house. Price fluctuations and the high cost of rent limit his profits, while his dream is to enter into a contract with one of the mobile phone companies to become a major distributor in the area. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy phones and phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi, in the region of Kampala in west Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Francis has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells human medicine. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items and human medicine for the pharmacy shop to sale, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his three children. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items and human medicine for the drug shop to sell

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the region of Kampala North in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past seven years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells human medicine and cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda.
