Su empuje, energía y su carisma lo han llevado a lograr todos sus objetivos, por lo que ahora solicita su quinto ciclo de crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, huevos, café, panela, lácteos, carnes frías, galletería, entre otros), así tendrá su negocio bien abastecido para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada decembrina que se aproxima, lo que le permitirá vender más productos y generar mejor nivel de ingresos para seguir solventando las necesidades básicas de su familia y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, pues Arnulfo sueña con incursionar en otros negocios como un café internet y papelería, pues ve en estas dos actividades una buena fuente de ingresos, con los que podrá disfrutar de una vejez más tranquila al lado de los que ama.
texts.en: Arnulfo lives with his wife, who helps him with his business, located in his home.  He has a grocery store and it’s been there for about 30 years, offering all kinds of food products to the area’s residents.  Thanks to its location, it’s very well-known and appreciated.  He works there every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and has been generating the income to support his family for three decades.  His drive, energy, and charisma have allowed him to complete all his goals and his is asking for his fifth loan to buy products in quantity (pastries, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, brown sugar, dairy, cold cuts, cookies, etc.)  In this way he will be well stocked to satisfy his customer demand during the December season that is nearing and he will be able to generate more income to cover his family’s basic needs and continue to invest in his business.  Arnulfo wants to become involved in other businesses such as coffee, internet, and paper goods.  These are good sources of income with which he can enjoy a nice old age with those who love him.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Héliane Claude Elame

texts.fr: héliane est une femme de 29 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant de 10 ans qui va à l'école. elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des mèches et des produits cosmétiques afin de augmenter son activité et. les bénéfices générés par ce crédit va être réinvestis dans son activité/capital et va permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition, loyer, éducation, santé)
texts.en:
Heliane is 29 years old, single, and a mother of a ten-year-old child who goes to school. She owns and has been running a hair salon in an area of the city for four years. 

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock by buying hair extensions and cosmetics in order to expand her business.

Earnings from this loan will be reinvested in the business and will allow her to support the needs of her family (nutrition, rent, education, health).

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 40-year-old married lady and enjoys doing embroidery by hand. She is very experienced and her embroidery patterns are very popular. She has three daughters and one son. Her husband is not in good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothing and education. 

Due to an increased demand of her embroidery designs, she needs to purchase raw materials such as spools of threads and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as spools of threads and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of 5 children. The man shown in the photo is Shumaila's husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw.

He has been driving a rickshaw for 5 years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shumaila has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shumaila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales, para obtener quesos ecológicos, con un alto contenido nutritivo en calcio, proteinas y fósforo. A la vez se contrarestará los problemas nutricionales de la leche que tienen un alto contenido en grasas saturadas, en triglicéridos y ácido graso saturado. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

El vive en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Achica Baja, del Sector Viacha de la provincia Ingavi, del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a dos horas de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

severo necesita el crédito para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de raza mejorada para usar su leche en la producción de queso ecológico.

El sueño de Severo es crecer y a mediano plazo, contar con su propia granja ecológica, la cual sea autosostenible y principalmente con BIODIGESTORES y BIOGAS, para lo cual se requiere de ganado que proporcione al menos 12 kilos de estiercol diario, que mezclados con 60 litros de agua, proporcionarán Metano por 4 horas diarias, evitando así la emanación de dióxido de carbono (CO2), para el cuidado del medio ambiente.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Severo, together with a group of people from the same community decided to care for the land and animals ecologically in order to obtain cheese with a nutritive content high in calcium, proteins and phosphorous. At the same time they will counteract the nutritional problems from milk that has a high level of saturated fat, triglycerides and saturated fatty acid. Their first step was to not tie up their cows nor keep them penned up far from the places they like to pasture. Neither would they cut off their horns so that they can birth calves naturally. Moreover they would give the animals fresh, high quality feed. 

Severo lives in his own house located in the community of Achica Baja, in the municipality of Viacha in Ingavi province in the department of La Paz, an approximately two hours journey from the city of La Paz.

Severo needs the loan to purchase a pair of improved breed milk cows so that he can use their milk to produce ecological cheese. 

Severo’s dream is to expand and in the medium term to have his own ecological farm which will be self-sustaining principally through Biodigesters and Biogas. To do this,  he requires livestock that will provide at least 12 kilos of manure daily, which, mixed with 60 liters of water will provide methane for four hours a day, thus avoiding the emission of carbon dioxide (CO2) in order to care for the environment. This is the third time he has applied for credit from IMPRO and the first time from KIVA,

loans.use: to purchase a pair of improved breed milk cows to incorporate into his milk producing business so that he can make ecological cheese.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales, para obtener quesos ecológicos, con un alto contenido nutritivo en calcio, proteinas y fósforo. A la vez se contrarestará los problemas nutricionales de la leche que tienen un alto contenido en grasas saturadas, en triglicéridos y ácido graso saturado. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

Betty vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la comunidad de Achica Baja, del Sector Viacha de la provincia Ingavi, del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a dos horas de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

El préstamo solicitado será utilizado para la compra de un par de vacas de raza mejorada para la obtención de leche de mejor calidad para la producción de queso ecológico.

El sueño de Betty es crecer y a mediano plazo, contar con su propia granja ecológica, la cual sea autosostenible y principalmente con BIODIGESTORES y BIOGAS, para lo cual se requiere de ganado que proporcione al menos 12 kilos de estiercol diario, que mezclados con 60 litros de agua, proporcionarán Metano por 4 horas diarias, evitando así la emanación de dióxido de carbono (CO2), para el cuidado del medio ambiente.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primeraa vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Betty, together with a group of other people in her community, decided to take care of the earth and of their animals, and so produce organic cheeses with a high nutritional content of calcium, proteins, and phosphorus. This would also counteract the nutritional problems of milk with a high saturated fat, triglyceride, and saturated fatty acid content. Her first step was not to tether her cows, nor to keep them shut up far from the pastures where they enjoy being, nor to cut off their horns, so that they would calve in a natural way and the milk they provided would be fresh and of a high quality. 

Betty lives in her parents' home in the community of Achica Baja, in the Viacha sector of the Ingavi province, in the La Paz Department of Bolivia, about two hours from the city of La Paz.

She will use this loan to buy a pair of cows of a modern improved breed, in order to generate milk of a better quality for the production of organic cheese.

Betty's dream is to grow and, in the medium term, to have her own organic farm. This would be sustainable and self-sufficient, using biodigesters and biogas. This would require livestock producing at least 12 kg of manure daily, which mixed with 60 litres of water would produce methane (for energy generation) for four hours each day, so avoiding carbon dioxide emissions and protecting the environment. 

This is the third time Betty has sought a loan from IMPRO, and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows of a modern improved breed, in order to generate milk of a better quality for the production of organic cheese.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San  Cayetano  está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, además de eso forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están haciendo encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como un medio de poder trabajar juntas y conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gorginia, quien cría y vende animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y demás. Comenta que su trabajo es muy duro, ya que debe estar pendiente siempre de sus animales, para que no les falte nada. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y que de esa forma pueda seguir con la cría de sus animales.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is in its first cycle of the committee for women.  They are also part of the program to eliminate poverty, where they are completing the elimination of poverty survey as a means to know their situations.

Gorginia is one of the members who raises and sells pen animals such as chickens, pigs, sheep, and others.  She says that this is very hard work and she must always care for her animals so that they are not in need.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy feed for her animals.  This will allow her to continue raising animals.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Eji Bitawa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Eji Bitawa  está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas.. Todas las integrantes son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona bastante rural.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser cerdos, gallinas, patos, etc. Luchando todas ellas por mejorar su vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fátima y ella pide de este crédito para comprar animales de corral para poder criarlos y venderlos después.
texts.en:
This group is called Eji Bitawa and is in its first cycle of the committee for women.  They are learning to work together and all are from the city of Curuguaty, a very rural area.

All the members raise and sell pen animals such as pigs, chickens, ducks, etc.  All are working to improve their lives and that of their families.

Fatima is one of the members and she is asking for this loan so she can buy pen animals to raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Maria Leyla

texts.es:
María Leyla de 54 años  madre soltera con un hijo mayor de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente, se caracteriza  por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de segunda mano como: pantalones de hombre y mujer, vestidos, faldas, blusas, sobrecamas, ropa de niño, juguetes de segunda mano. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa de segunda mano para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Leyla is 54 years old and is a single mother with an adult son.  She is originally from León, which is located in the western part of Nicaragua. She is known for being hard-working, responsible, and for having a great desire for personal growth.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Sadly she was not able to pursue her studies since she has had to work from the time she was very young in order to help out with household expenses.   

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she works selling second hand clothing like men's and women's pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, as well as bedspreads, children's clothing, and second hand toys.  She works around ten hours per day offering her products. The goal of the credit is to invest in product. This will allow her to supply her business by purchasing and selling second hand clothing so that in the near future she can obtain a better income.  María is thankful for the help that Kiva investors have offered to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that people can find dignified work.

loans.use: To invest in supplying her business with second hand clothes such as men's and women's pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, as well as bedspreads, children's clothing, and second hand toys.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia se dedica a la producción de pan y junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales, para obtener quesos ecológicos, con un alto contenido nutritivo en calcio, proteinas y fósforo. A la vez se contrarestará los problemas nutricionales de la leche que tienen un alto contenido en grasas saturadas, en triglicéridos y ácido graso saturado. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

Sonia vive en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Achica Baja, Sector Viacha de la provincia Ingavi, del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a dos horas de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Sonia Clara es crecer y a mediano plazo, contar con su propia granja ecológica, la cual sea autosostenible y principalmente con BIODIGESTORES y BIOGAS, para lo cual se requiere de ganado que proporcione al menos 12 kilos de estiercol diario, que mezclados con 60 litros de agua, proporcionarán Metano por 4 horas diarias, evitando así la emanación de dióxido de carbono (CO2), para el cuidado del medio ambiente.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar harina que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, puesto que  ella utiliza BIODIGESTORES en su panaderia.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Sonia works baking bread, and together with a group of people from her community, she decided to care for the land and raise animals to produce organic cheese. She says that the cheese is very nutritious and high in calcium, protein and phosphorous, which offsets its high content of saturated fat and triglycerides. 

One of the first steps Sonia took to ensure that the cows bear their calves naturally and produce milk that is fresh and high-quality, was not to tie up the cows or keep them in pens far from the pastures where they like to graze. She also does not cut their horns.

Sonia lives in her own home, which is in the community of Achica Baja, in the Viacha sector of the province of Ingavi, in the department of La Paz, which is about two hours from the city of La Paz.

Sonia says that her dream is to expand in the medium-term future, and to have her own organic farm, which will be self-sustaining and operated primarily with biogas produced by biodigesters. Sonia says that this process requires enough livestock to produce at least 12 kilograms of manure each day. When the manure is mixed with 60 liters of water, it can supply four hours of methane gas daily. This avoids the release of carbon dioxide, which helps care for the environment.

Sonia is requesting this loan to buy flour, which she says she needs very much to improve her work because she uses a biodigester in her bakery.

This is Sonia’s third loan with the field partner and the first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour to bake bread in her bakery, where the ovens use environmentally-friendly biogas.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se siente contenta por el apoyo, ella se dedica a la venta de celulares y tiene una pequeña tienda donde expende su mercadería por el momento otras persona administra el negocio pero en sus horas libre la encontramos vendiendo, ella también es profesora y enseña en uno de los colegio de la zona y le va muy bien, ella sigue  siendo parte del banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios como audífonos, baterías, estuches y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Hilda thanks all of the investors for the loan and she is happy for the support. She sells cell phones. She has a small store where she sells her merchandise. At the moment, someone else is managing her business but during her free time, she sells her merchandise. She is also a a teacher. She teaches at a local school and it is going very well. She is still a part of the Señor de Coyllority communal bank. At this time, she needs a loan to purchase accessories like headphones, batteries, cases and other items. She appreciates and values the loan. She promises to comply with the monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: purchase accessories like headphones, batteries, cases and other items.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia agradece a todos los inversionista por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella  sigue viviendo con su familia en la ciudad Paucartambo y continua vendiendo comestibles y participando en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority”, ella en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, detergente, gaseosas y se  compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Silvia is thankful to all of the Kiva lenders for the loan that she received previously, and she feels happy for the help given.  She continues living with her family in the city of Paucartambo and continues selling foods and participating in the communal bank "Señor de Coyllority."  Currently she needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise like bags of rice, bags of sugar, pasta, detergent, and sodas.  She promises to comply with the monthly loan repayment requirements very responsibly.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, pasta, detergent, and sodas

loans.name: Tushirikiyane Group

texts.fr:
Ange fait partie du groupe Tushirikiyane. Elle habite  à Gitega .Elle  a 25 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de mèches depuis 6 ans.           

Elle est à son sixième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de mèches à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Ange is a member of the Tushirikiyane group. She lives in Gitega. She is 25 years old and is married to a mechanic. Together they have two children, of whom one goes to school. 

Angie has been selling hair extensions for six years. 

She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy many hair extensions that she will resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions to resell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 39 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con sus dos hijos de 8 y 14 años. Ella inició su experiencia trabajando en una  empresa de confecciones y desde al año 2000,    emprendió su negocio de confección de ropa familiar, uniformes deportivos e industriales, logrando con sus propios ahorros,   implementar su taller.  Su labor inicia desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, vendiendo 50% de contado y el otro 50% a crédito. En su taller realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, desde el diseño, la preparación, el ensamble y acabado de piezas, elaborando los mejores productos, para se referidos en instituciones educativas, empresas y referidos de sus clientes en general. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y lograr educación universitaria para sus hijos, con los que sueña, ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Su mayor desafío es lograr ingresos suficientes, que complementen los de su cónyuge para lograr los sueños de prosperidad familiar. En a actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora con puntada especial, también comprará telas y otros insumos de confección. Con su nueva máquina la producción mejorará la calidad y ella sus tiempos productivos, haciendo de su credikiva una saludable inversión.
texts.en: Monica is 39 years old. She lives in the city of Barranquilla with her two children who are 8 and 14 years old. She gained experience working for a garment business and in the year 2000 she started her own business sewing casual clothing, and uniforms for sports and industry. She used her own savings to establish her office. Her work starts at 9 in the morning and lasts until 4 in the afternoon. She sells 50% of her items for cash and the other 50% via credit. In her office she completes all of the steps in the garment making process from design and preparation, to the assembly and finishing, which results in high quality products so she can be referred to educational institutions, businesses, and to her clients in general. Her goal is to increase the size of her business and to obtain a college education for her children whom she dreams of seeing grow into successful people. Her primary challenge is to obtain sufficient earnings, that complement those from her spouse, to reach their dreams of family prosperity. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan she will buy a filleting machine with a special stitch and purchase fabrics and other supplies for making clothing. With her new machines her production will be of a higher quality and it will increase her productivity, making this Kiva loan a healthy investment.

loans.use: to purchase a filleting machine with a special stitch and to buy fabrics and other supplies for making clothing.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man with six children living in Hoima, Uganda. He has been farming for four years now and does brick-laying as his side income. He faces challenges of seasonal weather variations and price fluctuations. His family goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to expand to new markets. 

Leonard is requesting for a loan to purchase wood and weed his maize.

loans.use: to purchase wood and to weed his maize.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a thirty year old married man living in Kamwenge,Uganda. He owns and operates a bar as his main source of income.  In addition, he has 2 side businesses (operating a taxi and farming) to earn a living. The challenges he faces are competition and customers who break his bottles. He has dreams of meeting his family's needs and educating his children through higher institutions of learning.

Edson is requesting a loan to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Alan Uriel

texts.es: Allan es un joven Originario de la ciudad de San Juan de Rio Coco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al alquiler de juegos de nintendo, el cual es un negocio estable y con un alto nivel de clientes que lo visitan. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que incremento su negocio y poder dar cada vez un mejor servicio. Solicita el crédito para comprar un nitendo Xbox 360, un control y flasheos de un play station 3, con el fin de diversificar su negocio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que ofertara nuevos nintendo para incrementar sus clientes y le generara buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Allan is a young man from the city if San Juan de Rio Coco.  He works in sales, renting nintendo video games.  It is a stable business with a high level of customers that visit.  He is thankful to Kiva and MiCrédito since their loan will allow him to grow his business and provide a better service.  He is asking for a loan in order to buy a Nintendo Xbox 360, a remote, and joystick/control boards for the play station 3, with the aim of diversifying his business.  He believes that the loan will be of great help since it will offer new games in order to increase his customers and generate better income.

loans.use: To purchase an Xbox 360, a remote, and joysticks / control boards for the play station 3.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Allah  Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 37-year-old married woman and her business has been selling milk for many years. She has two cows to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. 

She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, heath and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through its support. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the production of milk capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over seven years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she in her fifth loan cycle and requested a loan worth 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of sequins, beads and pearls in different colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Farzana has taken up. 

She has four children; two of her daughters help her in completing orders in less time.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of sequins, beads and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry fish to resell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est une femme de 44 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants dont le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 07 ans, tous allant à l'école. elle possède et gère un atelier de couture où elle confectionne des vêtements dans un quartier de la ville depuis 10 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des tissus afin d'augmenter son activité et ses profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital et permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille pour augmenter son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Julienne is 44 years old, married, and a mother of five children, of whom the eldest is 25 and the youngest is seven. All the children go to school.

Julienne owns and has been running a sewing shop for ten years, where she makes clothing. 

She is seeking a loan to strengthen her stock by buying fabrics that she can use to increase her business and profits.

Earnings will be reinvested and will allow her to support the needs of her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in Uganda. She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. 

For the past 15 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her tailoring shop, which designs clothes and sells materials. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material for the festive season.  It will help Christine to generate greater profits and improved business and better standards of living. 

Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a talioring school and buy more machines. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more material for the festive season

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en:
Samandar is 47 years old and is a master mason. Samandar is married and has two children. His 21 year old son studies at a technical college and his 18 year old daughter plays the piano and  wants to be a pianist. 

Samandar's family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli and now lives in the Baku region. Samandar is a master mason and builds stone walls. Samandar has been in this business for 13 years. He needs a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy new materials for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future he wants to recruit an assistant for his business.

loans.use: to buy new construction materials.

loans.name: Parivina

texts.ru: Паривина 33-летняя замужняя женщина, имеет четверых детей школьного возраста. Она работает в сфере торговли и занимается продажей традиционных лепешек. У ее мужа имеется пекарня рядом с рынком, где торгует Паривина. Он каждый день выпекает лепешки и Паривина сразу же в горячем виде выводит их на рынок на продажу. Это их семейный бизнес. Они занимаются производством и продажей лепешек более 6 лет. Сейчас мужу Паривине необходимо закупить сырье, чтобы печь лепешки. Так как их собственных средств не хватает на закуп, Паривина обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она собирается купить муку и дров для производства большего количества лепешек на продажу.
texts.en: Parivina is a 33-year-old married woman with four school-aged children. She works selling flat bread. Her husband has a bakery near the market where Parivina works. He bakes cakes every day and immediately Parivina sells them while they are still hot. This is their family business. They have been baking and selling flat bread for more than six years.Now, Parivina and her husband need to buy the raw materials to bake bread. They do not have enough money to pay for this, so Parivina requested a loan . The loan will be used to buy flour and firewood to produce more flat bread to sell.

loans.use: buy flour and firewood to make and sell flat bread.

loans.name: Segrario Emerita

texts.es: Segrario de 23 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que su hija tenga mejores condiciones a las que ella y su compañero de vida han tenido. Segrario se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos por la cual recibe una remuneración y de esta forma mantiene parte de la economía de su hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del corredor de la vivienda ya que con el tiempo las láminas se han agujereado y no tardará en venirse abajo. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Segrario is 23 years old and lives together with her life partner and her small daughter that is 4 months old. For her, what is most important is that her daughter has better living conditions than she and her partner have had. Segrario is in domestic services for a living for which she receives compensation and in this way maintains part of the household income. She wants to improve her living conditions and those of her family. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of the corridor of her home since due to weather, the sheet metal has holes and will soon collapse. With the loan she will purchase sheet metal, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails for the repairs to the corridor of her home.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is 58 years old, and he lives in the Askar camp at Nablus.  

Askar is a Palestinian refugee camp. It is located on the outskirts of the West Bank city of Nablus and was established in 1950 on 209 dunums of land. In 1960 the camp was expanded onto a further 90 dumums. Abass lives with his wife and six sons, one of them still in primary school.

Abass works in the construction sector, which helped him to build his house. He has asked Ryada for this loan to repair his house, because he has a shortage of money.  He needs to install doors for the closet in the kitchen and extend the electricity. 

Abass is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house, installing doors for the kitchen closet and extending the electricity

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of them currently in school. 

For the past eight years, James has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which sells suits for ladies, shoes, handbags, and party coats. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more suits, shoes, handbags, and coats.  It will help James to generate greater profits and have a booming business. 

ames hopes that in the future he will be able to have a big shop with all kinds of children's, ladies' and men's clothing. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more suits, shoes, handbags, and coats

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in Uganda.  He is married and has no children currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his general retail shop, which sells phones, shoes, and other accessories. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones, shoes, and other accessories needed for the shop.  It will help Stephen to generate greater profits, add to current capital, and increase profits. 

Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a big shop. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones, shoes, and other accessories needed for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the walls that have deteriorated and the roof of the corridor of her home.

loans.name: Usiano Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kakomere est une commerçante   depuis  7 ans et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Usiano» âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de transport en commun. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son mari. Elle souhaite construire sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédits  sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues   du système bancaire classique
texts.en:
Kakomere has been a merchant for seven years and is a member of the business group "Usiano." She is 37 years old, married, and a mother of seven children, who all go to school. Her husband is a driver in the public transport system. 

Kakomere sells used clothing. She started this business with funds from her husband. She is seeking a loan through Hekima to increase this business. She is going to buy one bale of used clothing.

She would like to build a house and educate her children. 

Kakomere thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who lack collateral and who are excluded from traditional forms of banking.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a married woman and a mother of five children from Getafe, Bohol. Consolacion is engaged in fishing. She sells fish, seashells and crabs. She has been in the fishing business for several years now with her husband.

Consolacion is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and crab cages. With this, she will be able to improve their catch with her husband, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Consolacion hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and crab cages

loans.name: Keburana Group

texts.fr:
Annociate fait partie du groupe  Keburana et  habite à Gitega. C’est une femme separée avec son mari.Elle a  2 enfants qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, ..) depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à  son  sixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz,de haricot,…à revendre pour gagner plus.

Grâce au gain de son commerce elle parvient à nourrrir et à faire soigner sa famille.
texts.en:
Annociate is a member of the Keburana group and lives in Gitega. She is separated from her husband and has two children who to go school. She has been a selling goods (like beans and rice) for six years. 

She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of rice, beans, etc. to resell and earn more. 

Thanks to earnings from this business she can feed and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, beans, etc. to resell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a hardworking woman who works hard to support her family. The previous loan helped her support her family. She again comes to you requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to buy sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour to earn additional income. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anastaziya

texts.en:
Anastaziya is a 50-year-old woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has four children and they all go to school. She sells cocoa, fish and Irish potatoes to both men and women. She has been in this business for ten years. Her main problem is the seasonal changes which affect her output. She plans to expand her business and generate more income in order to pay school fees for her children.
Anastaziya wants a loan to buy more cocoa, fish and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa, fish and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a retail business for five years. He also farms to earn additional income. He started the business for personal development and wants to look after his family by providing them with all the basic needs. He hopes to build a residential house, however debtors and price fluctuations are challenges that he faces.
John intends to use the loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Amany Group

texts.en:
Amany Group is composed of four women. They are from Hodiedah, Yemen. They work together to help one another. They are hardworking, enterprising women who do not give up easily. They are currently requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to expand their business levels.

Haind is the leader of the group. She is 27 years old and lives in Hodiedah. She started her business selling incense and perfumes when her husband could no longer afford their household expenses. Her business has helped her to provide for her family. She is turning to AMB to request a loan of 20,000 YER to buy incense and perfumes because she has pending orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes for expanding her business

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Абдусалом простой дехканин из района Хамадони. Всю свою семью он кормит за счет своей работы. Абдусалом всю свою жизнь посвятил работе на земле. Он всегда работал во благо своей семьи и зарабатывал своим честно нажитым трудом. Абдусалом один кормит свою семью. Он женат и имеет двоих сыновей. Абдусалому 37 лет. Более четырех лет он занимается земледелием, выращивает пшеницу. 
  Абдусалом спешить посадить зимнюю пшеницу, чтобы к весне получить урожай. Чтобы реализовать посев ему не обходим кредит. На сумму от кредита он приобретет горючей смеси для трактора и пшеничных зерен. Для Абдусалома кредит очень важен. Он верит, что к весне он получит богатый урожай.
texts.en:
Abdusalom is a simple farmer from Hamadoni. He feeds his family with his work. Abdusalom dedicated his life to working the earth. He has always worked the good of his family and has labored honestly.  Abdusalom alone feeds his family. He is married and has two sons. Abdusalim is 37 years old. He has been growing wheat for more than four years. 

Abdusalom is in a rush to plant winter wheat to get a spring crop. He needs a loan to make the planting. With the loan money, he will pay for tractor fuel and wheat. This loan is very important to Abdusalom. He believes that in the spring he will reap a rich harvest.

loans.use: buy diesel and wheat to sew a winter crop.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr:
Nogaye est membre du banc villageois Nob Sa Jëker depuis le 5 décembre 2007. Elle a toujours bénéficié des prêts qu'elle a remboursé sans difficultés.Elle est calme et très sérieuse dans son travail.


Madame Nogaye est âgée de 41 ans, c'est une femme mariée mère de trois enfants. Elle est couturière de formation et mène cette activité au niveau de son quartier.Elle posséde deux machines à coudre. Elle fait aussi du commerce de tissus.


Elle achéte ses tissus dans les marchés des grandes villes et de la capitale pour confectionner des habits et revendre dans sa localité. Pour garder sa clientèle elle choisit avec soin les tissus qui sont à la mode ( wax, voile, tissus teintés.....)


Nogaye compte acheter en grande quantité des tissus pour satisfaire sa clientèle et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle souhaite épargner afin d'atteindre une autonomie financière. Mais surtout recycler les bénéfices en fonds de roulement est l'un de ses  objectifs.
texts.en:
Nogaye has been a member of the banc villageois Nob Sa Jeker since 5 December 2007. She has always benefited from loans, which she always pays back without difficulty. 

She is calm and very serious in her work. She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of three children. 

Nogaye is a seamstress and conducts this business in her area. She owns two sewing machines. And she also sells fabrics. She buys fabrics in the large city markets and from the capital to make clothing to resell in her area.

To keep her customers, she chooses carefully fabrics which are in fashion (wax, voile, dyed fabrics…).

Nogaye plans to buy a large quantity of fabrics in order to satisfy her customers and earn more.

She hopes to save in order to become financially independent. Having enough cash flow is also a goal.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell

loans.name: Nusula

texts.en:
Nasula is 33-years-old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the  region of Mbale in Uganda. She is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past three years, Nasula has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which sells padlocks, rubbers and spare parts of various kinds. 

To help expand her business, Nasula has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to the business and buy more rubbers and padlocks and will help Nasula to generate greater profits and boost the business. Nasula hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger shop. 

Nasula is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nasula who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: add capital to the business and buy more rubbers, padlocks and spare parts of various kinds.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 39 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho, in the region of Mbalem, in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his farming business, where he raises cattle.
To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy vaccination medicines, feeds, more cows and will help Paul to generate greater profits and provide good quality meat and milk for his customers. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to boost his business and educate his children.
Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy vaccination medicines, feeds, and more cows.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 42 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in Uganda. He is married and has seven children, with five of them currently in school. For the past ten years, James has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho (maize flour), beans, rice and other items. 


To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rice, beans and posho and will help James to generate greater profits. The increase in his profits will hence pay his children's school fees and upkeep. 


James hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children. 


James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, beans and posho.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella operates a food stall business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. The previous loan helped her to buy home consumables and her income increased.
Again she is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase rice, wheat flour, soaps and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, soaps and sugar.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and lives in Bohol, the Philippines. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than ten years now.

Teresita needs a loan. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and to pay for the repair of their boat. 

With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Teresita dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair her boat

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.


She has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.

 
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. 


She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is musician from Aygehovit village in the Tavush region. He plays different musical instruments. Robert receives invitations for different events (weddings, birthday parties) and performs the musical part of the ceremonies. Robert would like to be able to expand his musical repertoire by purchasing drums. He has applied for this loan to purchase drums and provide a better service to his clients. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a big support to Robert and he will be able to increase his income to the benefit of his family. He lives with his wife, mother and two school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase drums to allow him to expand his musical repertoire.

loans.name: Edwin Efrain

texts.es:
Edwin, es soltero tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su madre de 65 años de edad, es un apersona muy luchadora que por la necesidad de generar más ingresos emprendió su propio negocio que consiste en una tienda, es una iniciativa que aprendió de algunos familiares, ya tiene cinco años con el negocio, que atiende todos los días sin ningún problema.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos y productos de limpieza tales como arroz, maíz, frijol, jabón, desinfectantes, etc., con estos productos tendrá su tienda surtida y con lo necesario para que sus clientes estén satisfechos, espera aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía y atraer a nuevos clientes.
Sueña con tener un negocio auto sostenible que le permita tener los recursos necesarios para ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación y salud de calidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is single and is 45 years old. He lives with his mother who is 65 years old. He is a very hardworking person. He needed to generate more income and therefore started his own business that consists of a store. It is an initiative he learned from some family, and he has 5 years with the business that he attends to daily without any problems.
He will invest the capital in to the purchase of basic grains and cleaning products like rice, corn, beans, soap, disinfectants, etc. With these products he will have his store stocked with what is necessary to satisfy his customers. He hopes to increase his sales to improve his income attract new customers.

He dreams of having a self-sustaining business that allows him to have the necessary resources to offer his family a higher quality of food and health.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains and cleaning products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Huda Group

texts.en: This group called Huda consists of five members who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 140,000 YER. Hafitha is 23 years old, married, and has children. She plans to work very hard in order to provide a better life for her family. She makes a living selling women's clothes, which she has been doing for two years. Many people prefer to buy her goods because she is hard-working, positive, responsible, and honorable. She has always kept her business well-stocked, which has allowed her many customers to visit and request products. Given that many people make requests, and each one is for a new style, she is requesting a loan for 40,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to purchase a variety of new styles of fabrics, blouses, and skirts to stock her business. She hopes to increase her income, which will in turn improve her and her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of new styles of fabrics, blouses, and skirts to stock her business.

loans.name: Dilcia Gricelda

texts.es:
Dilcia es una joven emprendedora, con muchos sueños, muchas esperanzas y anhelos de superarse y salir con 21 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos la cual vive con sus padres. Su familia únicamente depende del trabajo de campo como lo es el cultivo de café y ella por ende ayuda a sus padres en las diferentes actividades que en el campo se realizan desde hace más de 5 años siendo ellos quienes le enseñasen a trabajar la tierra. Ella trabaja junto a ellos pero también tiene un pedazo de tierra el cual fueron ellos quienes le heredaron la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada en bestia con el objetivo que ella pudiese trabajar y encontrar y dar valor de las cosas que a ellos tanto les ha costado y han conseguido mediante el esfuerzo realizado por muchos años. Como desafíos encontrados en el trabajo de campo que ella realiza ha encontrado las plagas y los cambios climáticos por parte de la naturaleza ya que la competencia no es problema para poder vender  y generar ingresos para su familia y hogar. 
Sus sueños son poder obtener más tierra y más plantación de café ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad del producto ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá tener una mayor estabilidad económica para re invertir en sus cultivos de café.
Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en: Dilcia is a young entrepreneur with a lot of hopes, dreams and desires to succeed and get ahead. She is 21 years old, single and without children. She lives with her parents. Her family depends solely on farming such as the cultivation of coffee and consequently she helps her parents with the different activities associated with the farm. She has been doing this for more than 5 years and it was her parents who taught her how to work the land. She works together with them but she also has her own plot of land that they gave to her which is located 2km from her house. They transferred it to her unkempt with the goal that she would be able to work and to understand the value of the things that they had provided to her and achieved through lots of work over the years. She has encountered some challenges with her work in the field including pests and changes in the natural climate, but competition is not a problem she faces and she is able to sell and generate an income for her family and home. Her dreams are to be able to obtain more land and a larger coffee plantation, and to offer to her clients a larger variety of products. Through this means she will be able to obtain better earnings and achieve better economic stability to reinvest in her coffee crops. Today she is seeking a loan that she will use to improve her crops by giving them better assistance through the application of agricultural products such as fertilizers, coffee formulas, and fungicides that prevent contamination by vermin and blights.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to support her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lidia Carolina

texts.es: Lidia tiene 28 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos, de 11 años, 9 años, 7 años y 4 años de edad. Se encuentra casada y junto a su esposo y sus hijos habitan en casa propia. Lidia se gana la vida trabajando como empleada de una institución cerca de su localidad. De esta forma colabora en la economía del hogar y lleva el sustento diario a sus hijos. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor de la vivienda puesto que por falta de ingresos no ha podido hacerlo por su cuenta. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pines.
texts.en: Lidia is 28 years old and is the mother of four children ages 11, 9, 7, and 4 years old. She is married and together with her husband and children they live in their own house. Lidia is employed in an institution close to her town. In this way she contributes to the household income and brings daily sustenance to her children. She wants to improve the condition of her housing and for that she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the construction of the corridor of her home since the lack of income has not allowed her to do it on her own. With the loan she will buy sheet metal, poles and pins.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, poles and pins for the construction of the corridor of her home.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the region of Mbale in Uganda. She is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Christine has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hair relaxing and plaiting. 


To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers and braids and to maintain the salon. This will help Christine to generate greater profits and attract more customers. 


Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy more hair products. 


Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers and braids, and to maintain the salon.

loans.name: Kaju

texts.en:
Kaju is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the region of Mbale, in Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Kaju has been working hard to manage his garage business, which sells spare parts and repairs are done.
To help expand his business, Kaju has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts, and will help Kaju to generate greater profits through selling goods at a higher rate which will allow him to pay school fees for the children. Kaju hopes that in the future he will be able to to be rich.
Kaju is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kaju who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for his repair center.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер молодой пекарь в возрасте 24 лет. Он проживает в районе Варзоб. Алишер женат и является отцом двоих маленьких детей. Он обеспечивает свою семью за счет своего пекарного дела. Алишер последние 5 лет вместе с братом занимается производством традиционных лепешек на продажу. Их пекарня расположена во дворе дома. После окончания школы Алишер у своего старшего брата научился выпекать лепешки и стал заниматься этим делом вместе с ним. Сейчас их деятельность хорошо продвигается. Алишер для расширения дела просит кредит. Он хочет закупить муки для производства большего количества лепешек.
texts.en: Alisher is a young baker, age 24. He lives in Varzob. Alisher is married and is the father of two young children. He provides for his family with his bakery business. For the last five years, Alisher and his brother have baked traditional flat bread. Their bakery is located in their home's yard. After high school, Alisher his elder brother learned to bake cakes and began work together. Now their business is progressing well. Alisher is asking for a loan to expand their business . He wants to buy flour to produce more flat bread.

loans.use: buy flour to make flat bread.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twelve years he has been involved in agriculture. With the profits he has been able to look after his family and pay school fees for all his children. However, he has been disturbed by floods, drought, pests and diseases that affect his crop production. In future he would like to open up a big store in town where his buyers will find him.
Charles intends to use the loan to buy pesticides and pay workers who work in his gardens.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay workers who work in his gardens.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman and a mother of a 15-year-old son from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now.

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat. Through this investment, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch; thus, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Esmeralda hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
Gerardina es de la zona de Puntarenas, Pacífico Central de Costa Rica,  ella vive sola, sus 3 hijos son mayores de edad.  Tienen 5 años de trabajar en el comercio, mantiene actividades consolidadas (ventas de catálogo, ropa, zapatos y otras) lo que permite una generación de ingresos estable y solvencia para el pago de la cuota. Inicia su trabajo  con Fundación Mujer en forma individual,  con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de su microempresa,  en una época muy buena para las ventas, la Navidad y la temporada de vacaciones de verano en la zona costera. 

Vive en una zona pobre y con limitadas oportunidades de empleo, este préstamo  le va a  permitir adquirir mercadería,  incrementando su inventario para   cubrir pedidos para época de vacaciones. 

Ella realiza la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que le permite tener un margen más amplio para la recuperación del dinero para el pago. Demuestran tener excelentes referencias de crédito y una amplia experiencia en el comercio. Desea crecer y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardina
2013-252
250.000

Gerardina is from the region of Puntarenas, Central Pacific in Costa Rica. She lives alone. Her three children are all adults. She has worked in the area of commerce for 5 years and has consolidated activities (catalog sales, clothing, shoes, etc.). This allows her to generate a stable income and to have solvency to pay her fees. She has started her work with the lending partner, Fundacion Mujer, on her own, with the aim to improve the conditions of her micro-business at a very good time for sales: Christmas and the summer holiday season in the coastal area.

Gerardina lives in a poor region, with limited employment opportunities. This loan will allow her to acquire merchandise, increasing her inventory to cover the demand during the holiday period. She will recover the money for the payment fees weekly, which will allow her to have a wider margin to get the money to make the payments. Gerardina proves to have excellent credit references and a wide experience in commerce. She wishes to grow and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, costume jewelry and others.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated a vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.
With the KES 20,000 that she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remove manual labor costs to gather the harvest with a sheller machine.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, vive junto a ellos en casa propia, se dedica a cultivar maíz y vender tamales, es una actividad que aprendió desde que era un niño, trabaja de forma independiente desde hace 5 años, atiende su negocio de lunes a sábado de 6:00 a 12:00 p.m.
Con el crédito pagara mano de obra, una maquina desgranadora y adquirirá insumos agrícolas (insecticida, plaguicida, herbicida y abono), con lo que espera tener una producción abundante, granos de calidad, aumento en sus ganancias y cancelar sus deudas.
Su deseo es mejorar su economía para darle a sus hijos salud, vestuario, alimentación y educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Miguel is 34 years old. He has two children, ages 8 and 12. He lives with his children in his own home. He makes a living by growing corn and selling tamales, which is an activity that he learned when he was a child. 

He has worked independently for the past 5 years. He attends to his business Monday through Saturday, from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm. 

With this loan, he will pay day laborers and purchase a threshing machine and agricultural supplies (insecticide, herbicide, and fertilizer). He hopes that these things will help him to have an abundant harvest, high-quality grains, higher income, and reduced debts.

His goal is to improve his financial situation to give his children health, clothing, food, and a quality education.

loans.use: to pay workers and to purchase a threshing machine and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es:
Raúl, está solicitando más capital para invertirlo en su panadería, en esta oportunidad comprara harina, azúcar, canela, levadura, etc., que son su materia prima para seguir elaborando las distintas clases de pan que vende.Tambien invertira en productos para su tienda.
La inversión anterior le dio un negocio más productivo, sus ventas son mayores, los ingresos nuevos le han permitido cancelar sus deudas,y cubrir los gastos de su hogar, tiene más clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Raul is requesting more capital to invest in his bakery.  At this time, he will buy flour, sugar, cinnamon, yeast, etc.  These are the raw materials used to make the various types of bread that he sells.  He will also invest in products for his shop.

Raul's previous investment made his business more productive.  His sales have increased, and this new income has enabled him to pay off his debts, cover the household expenses, and have more satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish and others items to expand her business,

loans.name: Wilmer Alexander

texts.es:
Wilmer un joven de 27 años de edad, entusiasta con deseo de trabajar y seguir superando en la vida, vive junto a su mamá de 55 años de edad, actualmente los dos trabajan.  Wilmer es empleado y la mamá de él, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de la Cuidad.

Wilmer tiene 4 años de trabajar en el Centro de Apoyo de Lactancia Materna, con el programa llamado Red Solidarias Rurales, ejerciendo su trabajo como supervisor de personal de capacitación de madres.

Con el préstamo se está ayudando, para que pueda comprar una motocicleta, ya que se le dificulta trasladarse de un lado a otro y más por el trabajo que desarrolla en la zona que está a 35 km de la cabecera departamental.

Wilmer piensa trabajar duro y así poder tener un mejor puesto.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a 27 year-old man who has an enthusiastic desire to work and continue to succeed in life.  He lives with his mom, who is 55 years old.  Both of them are currently working. Wilmer is employed, and his mother has a stall in the municipal market in his city.

For four years, Wilmer has worked in the Center for Breastfeeding Support, in a program called "Rural Solidarity Network."  He works as a supervisor of personnel who train mothers.

With this loan, you are helping him to buy a motorcycle, since it is difficult for him to get around from one place to another, and because his work is located in an area that is 35 kilometers from the department capital.

Wilmer plans to work hard so that he can get a better job.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two crates of soft drinks and ten bundles of cooking flour.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush is from Yerevan. She lives with her son, who is a student. 

Haykanush works at a local company and she is also involved in a retail business. Specifically, she sells clothing from her house. As a result of years of hard and tireless work, Haykanush has been able to gain a good client base -- customers who are ordering clothing and dressmaking supplies from Haykanush. 

Currently, Haykanush asks for financial support to purchase a new stock of clothing to sell to her clients, to meet their needs. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will help Haykanush to increase the variety of clothes she sells and she will be prepared for the coming high-demand during the winter holidays.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing.

loans.name: Sha'migul

texts.ru: Шаъмигул живет на районе Хамадони. Она разведена и живет с тремя детьми в родительском доме. У Шаъмигул два сына и дочка. Ее родители пенсионеры и нигде не работают. Родителей и детей обеспечивает Шаъмигул. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она шьет национальные платья по заказу. Для Шаъмигул это единственный источник дохода. Чтобы заработать на жизнь Шаъмигул много работает, поэтому ее старая машинка бистро поломалась. Ее машинка уже была старой и Шаъмигул шила на ней около четырех лет. На данный момент швейная машинка не пригодна для использования, по этой причине Шаъмигул берет кредит. Она намерена на деньги от кредита купить новую швейную машинку и продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Sha'migul lives in Hamadoni. She is divorced and lives with her three children in the family home. Sha'migul has two sons and a daughter. Her parents are retired and do not work. Sha'migul supports her parents and children. She is a dressmaker. She sews traditional dresses to order. This is Sha'migul's only source of income.  Sha'migul works a lot to earn a living, so her old machine broke down quickly . Her machine was already old and Sha'migul sewed with it for about four years. Now, her sewing machine is not usable. Therefore, Sha'migul is taking out a loan. She intends to use money from the loan to buy a new sewing machine and continue her work.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Selmith

texts.es: Selmith, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy alegre.  Es viuda y vive en compañía de sus tres hijos mayores de edad, más sus 05 nietos a los que quiere y engríe mucho en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Selmith es la venta de ropas de diversas calidades y para todos los  gustos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, los cuales compra localmente en la ciudad  y en ocasiones trae a pedido de la capital, y los lleva  a vender en zonas alejadas de la ciudad, como caseríos ubicados a los márgenes del río, a donde realiza viajes cortos, siendo muy conocida por esas zonas, en la mayoría de los casos entrega a pedido. Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 3 años, realizándolo en ocasiones por el apoyo y de algunos de sus hijos, que la acompañan en sus viajes por el río. Este sería el préstamo número 07 con Kiva, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, espera seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución, se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 2800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropas de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros, y comprará una máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Selmeth, who is 60 years old, is a determined woman, hardworking, and happy. She is a widow and lives with her three older children and her five grandchildren, who she loves and spoils. 

Selmeth makes a living by selling men's, women's, and children's clothing of various quality for all kinds of tastes. She sells the clothing locally and sometimes takes it to the capital to fill orders. She also sells the clothing in places far from the city, like in villages located near the river. When she makes these short trips, she is very well-known and fills orders.

She has been doing this job for more than three years. She has sometimes relied on the support of some of her children, who accompany her on her trips to the river. 

This is her seventh loan with Kiva. She likes working with her communal bank and hopes to continue to be able to rely on the support of the institution. She promises to continue to make her payments on time. 

With this loan of 2,800 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing for all genders and she will purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. She is married and has two children, currently in school. 

For the past 13 years, Jenny has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells all types of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jenny has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for a capital increment and to buy more clothes.  It will help Jenny to generate greater profits, and she will be able to pay school fees for her two children with time. 

Jenny hopes that in the future she will be able to have many businesses in Mbale. 

Jenny is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jenny who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add to her capital and buy more clothes

loans.name: Azizullo

texts.ru:
Азизулло 42 года. Он женатый мужчина. Азизулло отец пятерых детей. У него 2 сына и 3 дочки. Старший сын уехал за заграницу на заработки. Младший сын Азизулло живет с ним и помогает отцу по работе. Азизулло продает обувь на центральном рынке района Хамадони. В сфере торговли Азизиулло работает около 12 лет. Для него такая работа не трудная и очень интересная. Ему нравится общаться с новыми людьми и помогать людям с выбором обуви. В основном он продает мужскую обувь и в частности мужские рубашки и футболки, но основную часть его товара занимает обувь. 
  Пришла зима и многие жители покупают зимнюю обувь. Азизулло хочет на сумму от кредита привести зимнюю обувь и продавать на рынке. Тогда спрос на его товар увеличиться. И его деятельность будет процветать.
texts.en:
Azizullo is 42. He is a married man. Azizullo is the father of five children. He has two sons and three daughters. The eldest son went abroad for a job.  Azizullo's youngest son lives with him and helps his father work. Azizullo sells shoes in Hamadoni's central market. Aziziullo has been working in trade for about 12 years. This work is challenging and very interesting to him. He likes to interact with new people and to help people choose their footwear. He primarily sells men's shoes and some men's shirts and T-shirts, but he mostly sells shoes. 

Winter came, and many people are buying winter shoes. Azizullo wants to take out a loan to buy winter shoes and sell them at the market. Then, the demand for his products will increase, and his work will prosper.

loans.use: buy winter shoes.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед 29-летний торговец, проживает в районе Варзоб. Он вместе с братьями на рынке занимается продажей фруктов. Они заняты в этой сфере уже 8 лет. Умед в данный момент холост. Но он мечтает обзавестись своей семьей и иметь собственный дом. Для этого он сейчас усердно работает. Умед просит кредит, чтобы купить сезонные фрукты и увеличить количество продаж. Приближается большой праздник и его торговля будет расти. Поэтому он хочет успеть привести новый товар. Поддержите Умеда!
texts.en: Umed is a 29-year-old trader living in Varzob. He, along with his brothers, sells fruit at the market. They have been doing this for eight years. Umed is currently single, but he wants to start a family and own a home. He is now working very hard to achieve this. Umed is asking for a loan to buy seasonal fruit and increase his sales.
