Since a big holiday is approaching, and his sales will increase. Therefore, he wants to have enough time to bring in new goods. Support Umeda!

loans.use: to buy a large variety of seasonal fruit for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 33-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been selling cassava flour for four years on a retail basis at a busy street, plus farming as an additional source of income. She started this business to get income to sustain her family, and hopes to expand her business into a big store for both retail and wholesale supply to her customers.

Grace is requesting the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies to make dairy products

loans.name: Joiner

texts.en:
Joiner has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
Here again she is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush runs a small store. She sells mainly home supplies and cosmetics.

Anush lives with her mother, who is 80 years old. Anush has been running her store over ten years, and is the only breadwinner in her family. Because of the family's poor conditions, Anush isn't able to save money to increase her working capital. To be able to meet current market demand, Anush needs to increase the variety of selling products. 

Anush is asking for this loan to purchase new supplies to sell in her store. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will be a huge support for this hard-working woman, as she will be able to continue her small retail business and will be able to ensure normal living conditions for her retired mother.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to sell in the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, pepper, etc., for her business;

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado, ya que ella creció, junto a su abuela y ella ya no le permitió de que continuara con sus estudios, puesto que consideraba, que eso era una perdida de tiempo. Esta acompañada, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio. Sus tres hijos, están casados y ya no viven con ella, solamente vive con su esposo.

Blanca ha demostrado ser una persona luchadora, con muchos deseos de superación, lo que la a llevado a ser una gran comerciante de Gallinas Indias, oficio que aprendió, hace aproximadamente 34 años, desde que deserto de la escuela, gracias a una vecina y amiga que la apoyo, para que ella pudiera iniciar su negocio, ya que su amiga viajaba tres días por semana, a uno de los mercados mas importantes de la capital del país y a Blanca por su corta edad e inexperiencia, le permitió que viajara junto con ella, para que no se fuera a perder, y no le pasara nada malo. Así que como Blanca una niña de campo, le gustaba criar gallinas, decidió vender una parte de las que tenia, y le fue muy bien en el negocio. Desde entonces se a dedicado a este negocio. Ahora vende aproximadamente cuatrocientas gallinas por semana, ya que el trabajo es pesado recibe ayuda de su esposo y juntos mantienen el negocio, lo que a permitido estar mas tiempo juntos y mejorar la relación entre ambos.

Blanca necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio de las gallinas, ya que se acerca la época de fin de año, en donde la demanda de estas aumenta considerablemente, y es necesario para ella aprovechar esta temporada de venta. Con el préstamo se estará ayudando, para que logre comprar aproximadamente trescientas cincuenta gallinas, para luego llevarlas a comercializar.


Blanca tiene el sueño de ampliar el negocio, y así aumentar las ventas. Ademas le gustaría comprar un vehículo para poder trasladar las gallinas,  ya que actualmente, tiene que contratar un vehículo, lo cual aumenta los gastos de producción.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old and went to school through the fourth grade.  She grew up with her grandmother, who did not allow her to continue her studies since she thought they were a waste of time.  Blanca is married and her husband helps her with her business.  Her three children are married and no longer live at home.  Blanca lives alone with her husband.

Blanca has shown herself to be a fighter, with strong desires to get ahead.  This has allowed her to become a great seller of chickens, a business that she learned approximately 34 years ago, when she left school.  Thanks to a neighbor and friend who helped her, she was able to start her own business.  Her friend traveled three days each week to one of the most important markets in the capital of the country, and she allowed Blanca, with her young age and inexperience, to accompany her so that Blanca would not get lost and nothing bad would happen to her.  So since Blanca, a country girl, liked raising chickens, the neighbor decided to sell some of those that she had, and for Blanca the business went very well.  From that time she has been working in this field.  Now she sells approximately 400 chickens per week.  Since the work is heavy, she receives help from her husband and together they maintain the business, which has allowed them to spend more time together and to improve their relationship.

Blanca needs a loan in order to invest in her chicken business.  The holidays are approaching, and thus the demand increases considerably.  It is important that she take advantage of this season for sales.  With the loan she will be helped to purchase approximately 350 chickens, which she will then sell.  

Blanca dreams of growing her business and thus increasing sales.  She would also like to buy a vehicle in order to transport her chickens, since currently she has to rent a vehicle, which increases the costs of production.

loans.use: To purchase $350 chickens.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru:
Зокирчон родом из района Хамадони. Много лет своей жизни он провел там. У Зокирчона есть жена и дети. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в школе. У него три сына и две дочери. Зокирчон занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви в центральном рынке своего района. Зокирчону 38лет. И 10 лет своей жизни он работал в сфере торговли. В ассортимент его товара входят детские одежды, в том числе школьные и теплая обувь. 
   К приходу зимы жители спешат приобрести теплую зимнюю обувь. Зокирчон хочет привести новый товар теплой одежды и зимней обуви. К сожалению, чтобы купить необходимое количество товара, у Зокирчон не хватает денег, и он просит у Вас помощи. Он надеется, что Вы ему поможете!
texts.en:
Zokirjon is from Hamadoni. He spent many years of his life there. Zokirjon has a wife and children. His wife is a housewife, and his children are in school. He has three sons and two daughters. Zokirjon sells children's clothing and footwear in their region's central market. Zokirjon is 38 years old. He has spent ten years of his life working in trade. His inventory consists of children's clothes, including school shoes and warm shoes. 

With winter coming, residents are rushing out to buy warm winter shoes. Zokirjon wants to bring new goods, warm clothing and winter shoes. Unfortunately, Zokirjon does not have enough money to buy the goods, so he is asking for your help. He hopes that you 'll help him!

loans.use: buy shoes and children's clothes for resale in his local market.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with none of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Fredrick has been working hard to manage his stationery shop, which sells stationery items of various kinds. 

To help expand his business, Fredrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to the business and buy more stationery, and will help him to generate greater profits and hence open up a bigger shop. He hopes that in the future he will be able to become so rich. 

Fredrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fredrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to add capital to the business and buy more stationery

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 50 years old and lives in Nablus. He is married and the father of six sons, three of whom attend primary school. He earns a living by running a shoe store and has been in this line of work for many years. His store still needs a lot of improvement, so he is requesting a loan from Ryada to buy more items to sell and do some redesign work. Mohamad is very grateful to anyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to increase his sales by buying more inventory and decorating his store.

loans.name: Musuba

texts.en: Masuba is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has five children, two of whom currently attend school. For the last five years he has earned a living by running a hardware store. In order to expand his business, he has requested a loan for 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. Masuba will use the loan to buy more hardware items to sell. This will increase his profits, expand his store and help him meet his goal for the future of building many rental houses and giving his children the chance to receive a higher education. He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y deseosa de progresar.  Está casada con William quien es policía y padre de su hijo José de 16 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho. Vive junto a ellos en su casa propia . La actividad que realiza Doris es la confección. Aprendió este oficio ayudando a una amiga en su taller de confecciones, con las ganancias que logró ahorrar durante tanto tiempo pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser. Desde entonces tiene 10 años realizando este trabajo, tiempo en el cual ha logrado hacerse conocida e implementar poco a poco su local. Actualmente ella misma crea, diseña y refacciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Cuenta con la ayuda de 2 señoras más quienes la apoyan para cumplir con todos los pedidos que le asignan sus clientes. Le gusta su actividad porque le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventa los gastos de su hogar. Le gustaría poder ampliar su negocio, instalar más maquinas y abrir un taller grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y brindar a otras mujeres una oportunidad laboral. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto prestado comprará materiales de confección como telas, botones, agujas, blondas, elásticos e hilos en mayor cantidad para que siga cumpliendo su labor.
texts.en:
Doris, who is 45 years old, is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who wants to succeed. She is married to William, who is a police officer and is also the father of her 16-year-old son José. She loves them both very much. She lives with them in her own home.

She makes a living by making clothing. She learned this job when she was helping a friend in her clothing workshop. With the money that she was able to save during this period, she purchased her own sewing machine. Since then, she has been doing this job for 10 years, during which she has been able to make herself known and work on her storefront little by little.

Currently, she creates, designs, and repairs all types of clothing. She has two other women helping her to fill all of the orders that her customers make. She likes her job because it allows her to earn money to pay for household expenses. 

She would like to expand her business, install more machines, and open a larger workshop where she can better serve her customers and create more jobs for women.

At this time, she is requesting a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles. She is thankful and happy to know that she can continue to count on the support that she needs to grow her business. With the loan that she has requested, she will purchase sewing materials like fabric, buttons, needles, doilies, elastic, and thread in bulk so that she can continue to do her job.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials like fabric, buttons, needles, doilies, elastic, and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana Elizabeth tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Juna nos explica que se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, son una familia unida, su esposo se brinda servicios de labores agrícolas.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la construcción de una granja y compra de cerdos y así tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Elizabeth is 30 years old and lives with her family in the Zaña district. The residents of this district work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Perú's northern coast.

Three years ago, she started raising and selling small animals in her backyard. Juana reports that she decided to do this to help her husband with household expenses. They are a united family; her husband provides labor services to farmers.

She has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase nutritional feed and to build a barnyard and purchase pigs so that she will be able to make more money to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional feed and build a barnyard to keep pigs.

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es:
Norma Lidia es una joven emprendedora, con muchas esperanzas y muchos sueños de superarse y salir adelante con 21 años de edad ella es soltera y sin hijos la cual vive con sus padres. Su familia es agricultora y su ingreso económico depende del trabajo que realizan en el campo como lo es el cultivo de café. Ella apoya mucho a sus padres en el campo realizando diferentes actividades como ser limpieza, aplicación de abono, recolección de grano, etc. desde hace 6 años siendo ellos quienes le enseñasen a trabajar la tierra. Ellos también cultivan maíz y frijol y trabajan juntos en la tierra que pertenece a sus padres la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada en bestia o en carro. Como desafíos encontrados en el trabajo de campo que ella realiza ha encontrado las plagas como la roya, ojo de gallo el hielo etc. y los cambios climáticos por parte de la naturaleza ya que la competencia no es problema para poder vender  y generar ingresos para su familia y hogar. 
Sus sueños son poder comprar una despulpadora grande, obtener más tierra y más plantación de café para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad del producto ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá tener una mayor estabilidad económica para re invertir en sus cultivos de café considerando que si ella gana sus padres también lo harán ya que el negocio es familiar y muy unido.
Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos de café y granos básicos dando una mejor asistencia y limpieza aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Norma Lidia is a young entrepreneur with many hopes and dreams of getting ahead.  She is 21 years old, single, has no children, and lives with her parents.  Her family are farmers and their income depends on the work they do in the fields, such as raising coffee.  She supports her parents very much in the fields, doing different things such as weeding, composting, harvesting, etc.  She has been doing this for six years and it was they who taught her to work the land.  They also raise corn and beans and work the land together, which is located 2 km from their home and they travel there by car.  Challenges she faces include plant diseases such as “roya”, “ojo de gallo,” icing, and natural climate changes.  Competition is not a problem and she can sell her harvest and generate income for her family and household.  

Her dreams are to be able to buy a large pulping machine, obtain more land, and plant more coffee so she can offer her customers a better variety of products, have more financial stability, and make more considerable investments in her coffee crops.  If she wins, her parents also win because this is a family business. 

She is asking for a loan to improve her coffee and basic grain crops by doing better weeding, adding compost, fertilizer, and fungicides that prevent disease.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Paz De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Paz es una mujer de 31 años de edad, solo estudio 5° grado debido a la pobreza que tenia su familia, esta acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la policía, con el que ha procreado 2 hijos y ambos están en la escuela, y nadie más, vive con ellos.

Ella  se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde que tenia 15 años y fue con su mamá que aprendió el negocio, pues ella siempre le dijo que es bueno aprender un trabajo para salir adelante, ella nos cuenta que lleva ya 16 años de tener ese  negocio, además, con su pareja trabajan la agricultura, donde siembran maíz, frijol y maicillo, el negocio lo tiene a unos 30 minutos de su casa, para llegar ella tiene que caminar unos 30 minutos a pie, su jornada comienza a las 4:30 AM, donde primero pone a coser el miz y luego llevarlo al molino, a las 9:30 AM comienza a elaborar las tortillas y termina su jornada a las 6:00 PM, su pareja y su hijo mayor le ayudan en  el negocio.       

El préstamo sera utilizado, para construir una champa y guardar unos graneros que hoy los tiene afuera, comprara una docena de lamina, 10 cartones,  6 horcones, 200 ladrillos y 4 bolsas de cemento.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos hechos unos profesionales, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad, ampliar su negocio y un día sueña con tener una tienda,con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y dejar las puertas  abiertas, para seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Paz is a 31-year-old woman. She only went to school until 5th grade because her family was poor. She is married and her husband works in the police department. Together, they have two children who go to school and live with them. 

She makes a living by selling tortillas, which she has done for 15 years. She learned this business from her mother, who always told her that it is good to learn a trade so that you can move forward. She reports that she has had this business for 16 years and also works with her husband in agriculture, growing corn, beans, and sorghum. The business is located 30 minutes from their home. To get there, she has to walk 30 minutes. 

Her workday begins at 4:30 am when she bags the corn and takes it to the mill. At 9:30 am, she begins to make tortillas and finishes at 6:00 pm. Her husband and her oldest son help her with the business.

She will use the loan to build a shed to guard some grain that is outside, and to purchase a dozen metal sheets, 10 cardboard boxes, 6 wooden posts, 200 bricks, and 4 bags of cement. 

Her dream is to see her children become professionals since she did not have that opportunity. She would also like to expand her business and, one day, open a store. With her income, she hopes to pay off her loan and leave the door open to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to build a shed to guard some grain that is currently outside, to purchase a dozen sheets of metal, 10 cardboard boxes, 6 wooden posts, 200 bricks, and 4 bags of cement.

loans.name: Blanca Libia

texts.es: Blanca, a sus 63 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde actualmente posee cultivos de uchuvas y flor de caléndula cuyas cosechas son vendidas a un cliente que se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad; adicionalmente, complementa sus ingresos con la producción de leche que obtiene de 6 vacas de su propiedad, la cual es vendida a un vecino del pueblo que tiene tanques de frío para almacenarla; de esta manera logra generar los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La cliente se caracteriza por su pujanza, su dinamismo y actitud positiva con la que enfrenta la vida, lo que la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar 2 vacas productoras de leche, con las que podrá reemplazar a dos animales que están en periodo de gestación; esto le permitirá mantener su producción al mismo nivel y no perderá los recursos económicos que éstas le generan. De esta forma, Blanca desea seguir luchando incansablemente para seguir avanzando en sus negocios y espera poder cumplir el sueño de aumentar la producción lechera mínimo con 10 vacas, para garantizar una mejor rentabilidad y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca is 63 years old, married and is the mother of 4 children. All her life has been spent in the fields, where today she has crops of gooseberries and marigolds. The harvests are sold to a customer located in the city. Additionally, she supplements her income with the production of milk, for which she owns 6 cows. The milk is sold to a neighboring town that has freezing tanks to store it. In this way she generates sufficient income to support the household. The client characterizes herself by her strength, her dynamism and her positive attitude with which she faces life, which drove her to request a loan to buy 2 dairy cows. With this purchase, she will be able to replace two animals that are in a period of gestation. This will allow her to maintain production at the same level and she will not lose the income that they generate. In this way, Blanca wants to continue tirelessly working and continuing to advance in her businesses and hopes to be able to achieve her great dream of growing to a minimum of a 10 dairy cow production to guarantee a ensure better profits and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Salam  has been working hard to manage his business, which sells cement. 

To help expand his business, Salam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to the business and buy more cement, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees to better schools for his children's education. He hopes that in the future he will be able to have a very big business. 

Salam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: add capital to the business and buy more cement

loans.name: Guar

texts.en:
Guar is 45 years old and lives in Baku region. She is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. 


Her elder daughter is married. One of her sons studies three courses at university, and the other son goes to class 11 at school. Her little daughter is learning the tailoring profession. Guar’s husband is a taxi driver, and Guar is a cook. She makes national dishes in the restaurant. 


Now she needs a loan amount of 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a new fridge, pots and pans. Therefore, she applied to Komak. 


Guar is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for the loan. In the future, she wants to have a cook store.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge, pots and pans.

loans.name: Eiva

texts.es: Eiva, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Oswaldo quien es técnico en refrigeración. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus 2 hijos. Vive cómodamente en su propia casa que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Eiva es el servicio de mantenimiento de equipos de refrigeración, para eso ha instalando un pequeño taller en su propia casa en donde tiene los implementos necesarios para desarrollar su labor. Se inició con pocos pedidos y actualmente la demanda de su trabajo se ha incrementado. Empezó a ejercer esta actividad hace 1 año con la ayuda de su pareja ya que él es quien tiene todos los conocimientos adquiridos en sus estudios técnicos. Su función dentro del negocio es de atención al cliente, administración de gastos, promoción del servicio y difusión de los productos que ofrece. Le gusta su actividad porque le permite mantener su tiempo ocupada en un trabajo le genera el ingreso económico que necesita para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de equipar su taller con mejores implementos y consolidar un local de atención más amplio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará motores de refrigeración y balones de gas valorizados para equipar su taller y continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Eiva is 40 years old. She is a hard-working and earnest woman. She is eager to get ahead. She is married to Oswaldo who is a refrigeration technician. She lives with her husband and her two children. She lives comfortably in her own home which she bought with a lot of effort. Eiva services and performs maintenance on refrigerators. For this reason, she has installed a small workshop in her home where she has the necessary tools to do her work. She started with a few orders and now the demand for her work has increased. She started this business a year ago with the help of her husband since he has knowledge from his technical studies. 
Her role in the business is customer service, expense management, marketing and diffusion of offered products. She likes the business because it allows her to use her busy time in a job that generates necessary income for household expenses. She has plans to equip the workshop with better tools and to consolidate into a bigger location.  She is requesting S/.  2500. She is very excited to know that there are people who give economic support so she can continue developing her business. She promises to be a member who is punctual with her payments. With the requested loan, she will buy refrigeration motors and gas tanks to equip her workshop and to continue developing her business.

loans.use: purchase refrigeration motors and gas tanks.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is 44 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has two children, neither currently in school. 

For the past five years, Benedicto has been working hard to manage his sale of produce, which deals in produce and other items. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce.  It will help Benedicto to generate greater profits for business expansion. 

He hopes that in the future he will be able to have multiple businesses. 

Benedicto is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benedicto who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more produce

loans.name: Emerita Gabriela

texts.es:
Emerita Gabriela tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en la zona rural de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz y maíz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza colonias, labiales, polvos compactos entre otros y asesoramiento a sus clientes que en la mayoría son mujeres, es conocida por el buen servicio que brinda.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos de cabello y así tener más variedad de productos para ofrece a sus clientes y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Emerita Gabriela is 19 years old. She lives with her husband and their son in the rural area of Cayaltí. The residents of this area make a living by growing sugar cane, corn, and rice. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Perú's northern coast.

She makes a living by selling beauty products like cologne, lipstick, face powder, etc. and providing advice to her customers, who are mostly women. She is well-known for the good service that she provides.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase hair products so that she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair products.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es: El señor Aldo tiene 34 años de edad vive solo y no tiene dependientes, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Valle Nuevo. Sus principales actividades son la producción y venta de maíz dekal que lo realiza una vez durante el año sembrando en los terrenos de sus padres y la cría de ganado vacuno a campo abierto. Trabaja arduamente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, es por eso que requiere un crédito para comprar  semilla de maíz y agroquímicos, de esta manera logrará tener mayores ingresos para pagar los gastos que tiene durante el proceso de producción y otros en los que incurre.
texts.en:
Aldo is 34 years old. He lives alone and has no dependents. His home is located in the community of Valle Nuevo. His main activity is growing and selling corn. He plants once a year on his parents land and also raises cattle on open land.

He works hard to cover his household expenses. It is for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy corn seed and agrochemicals. In this way he will be able to generate more income to pay the expenses that he has in the growing season and other costs that come along.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: El señor Renato es una persona mayor y vive con su conyugue, es de escasos recursos económicos  y no cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para pagar sus gastos, vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque. Contrata personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos y los tiene que llevar a vender  hasta la feria local, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de abono y semilla, de esta forma seguirá obteniendo ingresos y podrá mejorar las condiciones en las que vive.
texts.en:
Señor Renato is an older man. He lives with his wife in a rural part of Tiraque province. They have little income, nor do they have any children to help pay for household expenses.

He hires a labourer to help plant his fields and harvest the produce and then has to take it to the local market to sell. The loan Renato is seeking will be used to buy fertilizer and seeds. He will be able to earn more money and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en la zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de algodón y maíz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tienen una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, donde ofrecen venta de cerveza, gaseosas, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, Yrma ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza, golosinas y gaseosas para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yrma is 42 years old, she lives with her husband and her young son in the rural area Oyotun, located a couple of hours away from the city of Chiclayo, in the northern coast of Peru. There, the population works mostly in livestock and farming (cultivating cotton and corn).

They opened a small business located in their own home, where they sell products like soft drinks and beer, and her husband helps her with this work. Yrma is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, to buy soft drinks, candy and beer, to supply her business and continue to generate an income.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks and candy to supply her business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá Group

texts.es: Rosiris es integrante de Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá, con apenas de 19 años de edad es casada y madre de 2 niños pequeños, ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos para la venta, y con eso ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares. La economía de su familia está sustentada en el trabajo de su esposo como agricultor en una pequeña finca; El dinero que recibe como pago por su trabajo es muy poco, es por eso que Rosiris busca la manera de ayudar, generando un ingreso adicional.  Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y sus alimentos. En el grupo están 4 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Rosiris is a member of the Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá. She is just 19 years old, married, and has two small children. She makes a living by raising pigs to sell. This is how she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Her husband supports their family as a farmer on a small farm. He does not earn much money at this job, so Rosiris wanted to find a way to help earn more money.

This is her third loan and she will invest it in the purchase of pigs and food.

The group includes four other women who will invest in other farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, food, vitamins, and other things.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia de 41 años de edad, solo estudio 6° grado debido a que sus padres  no tenían suficiente recursos, para seguir dándole el estudio, y tuvo que dejar la escuela para ayudar a su papá en los gastos del hogar, actualmente esta acompañada y con su pareja han procreado 3 hijos, pero uno de ellos ya esta acompañado, solo viven dos en casa, y de ellos  solo uno esta estudiando, ya el otro salio del bachillerato pero él que esta estudiando sueña con ser un licenciado en administración de empresa. El esposo de Sonia trabaja en construcción.

 Sonia debido a que no estudio, no tuvo oportunidad de encontrar un trabajo diferente, nos cuenta que desde hace  10 años para ayudar a su pareja se dedica a trabajar como domestica en una casa del pueblo. Para llegar a donde trabaja tiene que caminar todos los días 25 minutos, donde comienza su horario  de trabajo a las 6:30 AM y regresa a casa a las 5:PM, para tomar un descaso.       

El préstamo sera utilizado, para pagar un dinero que utilizo en los gastos de una operación que le hicieron y otra parte para unos gastos que le están pidiendo a su hijo en el instituto. 

Su sueño es ver a su hijo  hechos un profesional, pues los otros solo el bachillerato sacaron y ya no quisieron continuar, pero él sueña con triunfar y  quiere ayudarle a cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Sonia is 41 years old. She only went to school until 6th grade because her parents did not have sufficient resources to send her to school, so she had to drop out of school to help her father with household expenses. She is currently married and has three children, one of whom is married. Her other two children live at home, and one is in school. One of her children graduated from high school, and the other one hopes to earn a degree in business administration. Sonia's husband works in construction.

Since she could not finish school, Sonia never had an opportunity to find a different job. She reports that she as worked for the past 10 years as a domestic worker in a house in town. To get to her job every day, she has to walk for 25 minutes. She begins her work day at 6:30 am and returns home at 5:00 pm to rest. 

She will use the loan to pay medical bills from an operation that she had and to pay expenses that her son's school is requesting. Her dream is to see her son become a professional, since the others only have a high school education and do not want to continue. But one of her sons dreams of succeeding and she wants to help him achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay medical bills from an operation that she had and to pay for her son's education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en San Juan de Chorrillos, una zona rural de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente actividad que consiste en hervir el jugo de la caña y luego de un proceso se purifica para utilizarlo con fines curativos, antiséptico, como una bebida para celebrar en ocasiones especiales, es conocido en la zona por la actividad que realiza.

Marino ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para compra de caña materia prima de elaboración de su producto y de esta manera tener una mayor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano, 49 years old, lives with his wife in San Juan de Chorrillos, a rural area of Callayuc, in the region of Cajamarca, north of Peru. The residents of this community work mostly in agriculture, livestock and commerce. 

Mariano works in the distillation of liquor (“aguardiente”), a process that consists of boiling the juice from sugar cane, and after it undergoes a phase of purification, it can be used for either curative/medical purposes, or as an alcoholic beverage for special celebrations. Mariano is well known in the community for his business.

He is requesting a loan of 4500 nuevos soles, to purchase sugar cane to increase his production and  sales, ultimately increasing the family income.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane for the distillation of liquor.

loans.name: Luisa Nohemi

texts.es:
Doña Luisa es una Mujer de 36 años de edad muy alegre, y soñadora que desde muy joven adquirió los conocimientos en la agricultura por medio de sus padres especializándose en el cultivo de café. Diariamente se levanta por la mañana a sus quehaceres para luego desplazarse hasta su centro de trabajo donde da clases como maestra de educación. Ella es madre de 5 hijos el mayor en secundaria, los 2 que le siguen en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y los últimos 2 son menores de edad por lo que no asisten aun al kínder. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de café desde hace 7 años actividad que aprendió por medio de sus padres ya que ellos son comerciantes y agricultores y por años le han vendido su producto al beneficio de la comunidad siendo el mayor y prioritario cliente. Doña Luisa en temporadas navideñas también vende ropa para la temporada lo cual le permite obtener mejores y mayores ingresos para su familia. Como esposa al salir de su centro de trabajo se desplaza al campo para ayudar a su esposo el cual está a cargo de las diferentes actividades mientras ella no lo apoya como la limpieza, recolección del gano, aplicación de abono, etc. 
Sus sueños son los de poder seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café para que en el futuro sus hijos puedan heredar una tierra digna y prospera la cual le permita tener una tierra donde vivir, donde trabajar y generar ingresos para su hogar. Por esa razón ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas con los cuales comprara abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, etc. que ayuden al desarrollo crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a happy, 36 year old woman.  She is a dreamer, and when she was very young, she acquired agricultural knowledge from her parents, who specialized in coffee growing.  She arises in the morning, does her chores, and then goes to her workplace where she teaches classes.  She is the mother of five children.  The eldest is in high school, the next two are in primary school in different grades, and the last two are minors that don’t even attend kindergarten yet.  She has been engaged in buying and selling coffee for seven years, an activity she learned from her parents as they are business people and farmers.  For years, they have sold their product to the benefit of the community, their largest and main customer.  Luisa also sells clothing during the Christmas season, which allows her to earn better and higher income for her family.  When she leaves her workplace, she goes to the country to help her husband who is in charge of various activities and she helps him with the clearing, grain collection, fertilizer application, and other activities.

She dreams of being able to continue expanding her coffee crops so that in the future, her children can inherit decent, prosperous land.  This will allow her to have land where she can live, work, and generate income for her home.  For this reason, today she is requesting financing from the Comixmul  cooperative and she will use the funds to buy farming inputs such as manure, leaf fertilizer, coffee formula, and other supplies, which will help her  develop, grow, and strengthen her crops.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs to aid her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 30-year-old, married man with four children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in produce-selling, a barber shop, and a public address system. His dream is to build his home and to expand his business into new markets. He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations. He appreciates the financial support given by the lenders. 

Tom needs the loan to buy more stocks of beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maria Etelina

texts.es:
María Etelina es una joven 28 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora ya que desde muy temprana edad se ha dedicado a la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café. Ella también elabora viveros de café en compañía de su compañero de hogar ya que día a día se dirigen hasta donde están ubicados sus cultivos donde ambos dan el mantenimiento necesario como la limpieza, poda y la aplicación de fertilizantes. María Etelina es madre de 2 hijos el mayor acaba de salir de primaria del curto grado y el próximo año para al quinto grado y el más pequeño de 2 años de edad. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero de sus padres. En tiempo libre ella también se dedica al corte y confección desde hace más de 8 años. La tierra que en familia trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada muy cerca de su casa permitiendo asistir de una mejor forma sus cultivos y viveros de café.
Por lo que hoy día ella no deja de soñar y creer que algún día llegara a extender sus cultivos y a ofrecer mayores cantidades a los compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto, higiénico y con un precio en el mercado competitivo para poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia y el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos. Ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el que comprara 50 bolsas para elaboración de viveros, 100 libres de semilla de café certificada, 1 royo de alambre de púas con el cual protegerá, 40 postes de madera para sembrar y formar el cerco con el alambre de púas de esa manera ella podrá asegurar y proteger sus cultivos de café
texts.en:
María Etelina is 28 years old. She is a fighter and an enterprising woman who very young started to work in agriculture. Growing coffee is her specialty. Along with her husband she also has coffee nurseries. They go out day by day to where their plants are and maintain them as necessary, cleaning, pruning and applying fertilizer.

María Etelina is the mother of two children. The oldest just finished Grade 4 and next year will move on to Grade 5. The youngest is 2 years old. María Etelina has a degree in Primary Education which she was able to complete thanks to the moral and financial support of her parents. For the past 8 years she has been dress-makiing In her spare time.

The land that they work is theirs thanks to an inheritance from her parents. It is located close to their house making it easier to work on their crops and nursery. Today she dreams of having more land and of being able to offer more product to the buyers who come to find quality, clean product at a competitive market price. This would generate more revenue for the family and the well-being and future of her children.

María Etelina is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL to buy 50 bags to build greenhouses, 100 pounds of certified coffee seed, 1 roll of barbed wire and 40 wood posts to build a barbed wire fence to secure and protect her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Josefina Manuela

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos, cerdos y patos, los ofrece en el mercado de la zona y los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Josefina is 34 years old . She lives with her husband and her children in the district of Cayalti, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in commerce, agriculture and raise livestock.

Josefina raises and sells goats, pigs and ducks. She sells them in the local markets and in the villages close to her community. She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy balanced feed. She will have increased production which she can offer to her clients, generating more revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten young animals.

loans.name: Mario Felipe

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Cocoña, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido.  Cada día Mario trabaja con mucho entusiasmo y esfuerzo ya que el es agricultor, sobre todo porque este humilde trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Mario está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, semillas, entre otros y de esta manera podrá tener un mejor cultivo y podrá mejorar su cosecha y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Mario is a hardworking man who lives in the town of Cocoña, known for its warm climate. Mario goes to work every day with a lot of enthusiasm and energy as he is a farmer, and his sole source of income to support his family comes from farming.

Mario is grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds etc. Then he will have more fertile fields and better yields. He will be able to work towards his dream of completing the construction of his house.

loans.use: Buy manure, fertilizer, seeds etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, comercio de los mismo y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ataúdes, trabaja en convenio con La Municipalidad de Pucara y Posta médica, adicionalmente brinda servicios de costura, lavado de ropa, es conocida en la zona por actividad que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra arreglos florales de plástico, capillas pequeñas de vidrio y poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old. She lives with her children in the district of Pucará, two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here grow and sell fruit and raise cattle.

Maribel sells coffins, working in agreement with the Municipal services and Medical Station of Pucara. She also offers sewing services and cleaning clothing. She is well-known in the area for the work she does. She is requesting a loan of 800 PEN to buy plastic flower arraignments and small glass chapels to offer more variety to her clients. This will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy floral arraignments and chapels to stock her funeral home.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el Asentamiento Humano Capitán Quiñones – Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, cosa norte del Perú.

Ella brinda el servicio de internet y video juegos, además de criar y vender animales menores como aves de corral teniendo como punto de venta su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para mejoramiento de su local y de esta manera tener un ambiente adecuado para seguir brindando su servicio.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 26 years old and lives together with her husband and son in the settlement community of Humano Capitán Quiñones - Morropon.  The residents of the area work in agriculture, sales and livestock.  It is located about two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Perú.

Rosaura offers a business with video games and internet, as well as raising and selling small animals like birds.  She sells from her home.  She is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to improve her store front and in that way have an environment more adequate in order to continue offering her services.

loans.use: to plaster and paint the walls of her business.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el caserío de Playa Azul, distrito de Colasay, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la Provincia de Jaén Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Tiene una bodeguita que ofrece productos de primera necesidad leche, menestras, arroz, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de campaña navideña panetones, vinos, arreglos navideños luces, entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Leonilda is 48 years old.  She lives with her husband and child in the rural Playa Azul settlement in the Colasay district.  The population here works in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.  This area is 2 hours from Jaen province in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru

Leonilda has a small store where she sells consumer staples such as milk, beans, and rice.  She has requested a loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy inventory for the Christmas season such as panettones, wine, Christmas light decorations, and other products. This way, she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to stock  her store with Christmas items such as panettones, wines and Christmans light decorations

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná y es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello trabaja como obre agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo puede sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su familia.

Jaime está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Comprar un auto para poder trabajar”.
texts.en:
42-year old Jaime lives in the town of Camaná. He is very keen to make progress in life. He farms land in the town and with income from his simple farm he supports his family as best he can.

Jaime is grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy construction supplies to make improvements to his house. This will improve his quality of life and he will be able to work towards his great dream of owning a vehicle.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en el caserío Chumbenique una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo, de 500 nuevos soles para arreglos de dormitorio de vivienda y de esta manera tener un espaci agradable para descanzar.
texts.en:
Raquel is 36 years old and lives together with her husband and son in the hamlet of Chumbenique in a rural zone of Oyotun.  People in the area work in agriculture, sales, and livestock.  The town is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Raquel works raising and selling small animals and has been doing so for five years.  Her business is located in her home.  Her husband works in agriculture.  She is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to finish a room in her home and in that way have a more agreeable place to rest.

loans.use: To finish a room in her home.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising women. One of them is Sarah, who is 64 years old and a widow. 

For the past 31 years her business has been the sale of fish. She buys from the cool store and sells in Teshie. She requests this loan of GHS 700 in order to purchase two cartons of fish to sell to customers.

Badu and Narkie are 67 and 65 years old, respectively.  The group needs a total amount of GHS 1,500 to buy fish and foodstuffs to sell to customers.

loans.use: To purchase two cartons of fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 31 years old and married, with four children. She runs a domestic products business in the Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She started her business to support her home.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells glass cups, knives, and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is sometimes slow purchasing power.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food container for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un señor casado de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Comenta que actualmente tiene un negocio de compraventa de café y zapote a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad porque en su comunidad existe una fuerte demanda en este tipo de negocio, que es bastante productivo y rentable.
A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le han ayudado a contribuir a la economía de su familia. Es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de café y zapote, que servirá para incrementar más  sus ganancias para mejorar la economía de su familia.
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio para que genere más ganancias y así comprar un terreno para tener su propio cultivo, de esta manera mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel, 54, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Suchitepequez department. He has a coffee and sapote store a few meters from his house. He started this work because of strong, local demand for this type of business, which is productive and profitable. He is able to earn enough income and profit from the business to help his family's financial situation. He has applied for a loan of Q 6,000 to buy coffee and sapote, which will increase earnings and improve the family's finances. His biggest dream is to earn more and buy cropland to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy coffee and sapote for his business.

loans.name: Segundo Concepcion

texts.es:
Segundo Concepcion tiene 66 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hijos en Chafan, distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, arroz, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Tiene una finca donde se dedica al cultivo y comercio de lima, desde hace más de 10 años, su producto lo distribuye por las zonas aledañas a su distrito, también tiene cultivos de café que el próximo año cosechará.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 600 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a sus fincas con la compra de abono y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Segundo Concepcion is 66 years old and lives along with his wife and sons in Chafan, a district of San Felipe.  People in the area work growing fruit and rice, selling those same crops, and raising livestock.  The town is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the northern mountains of Perú.  

He has a farm where he grows and sells limes, and he has been working in this field for more than 10 years.  He product is distributed in the neighboring zones of his district, and he also grows coffee which will be harvested after the new year.  

He is asking for a loan of 3600 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to maintain his fields by purchasing fertilizer and in this way have a better crop to offer his customers, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene un negocio ubicado en su domicilio donde ofrece servicios de tipeos, copias, internet sus padres le apoyan en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercaderías, papel bon, tinta, folders y una computadora para aumentar su negocio y generar más ingresos a la familia..
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 32 years old and lives with his parents in the district of Cayaltí. People in the area work in agriculture, sales, and livestock.  The town is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.  

Miguel has a business located in his home where he offers services for typing, copies, and internet.  His parents help him with this work.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase merchandise such as bond paper, ink, folders, and a computer in order to increase his business and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy office supplies and a computer.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado caprino, las compras lo realiza en caseríos aledaños a su comunidad y posteriormente lo ofrece en el distrito de Chiple conocido por ser un lugar donde se reúnen las mejores cabezas de ganado de la zona, también se dedica al cultivo de cacao.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para dale mantenimiento a su finca con la compra de abono y así tener una mejor producción, para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Leonides, 47, lives with his wife in the district of Pomahuaca, which is in the Cajamarca area in Peru's northern mountains. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. Leonides raises goats. He buys from nearby farms and later sells in the Chiple district, where the best livestock are brought and where cacao is grown. He has applied for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles to maintain his land and buy manure so that he has more production to offer his customers and has more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure for his cropland.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes su negocio se encuentra en su domicilio, siendo sus clientes vecinos y conocidos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nathalia, age 32, lives with her children in the Pucara district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountains of Peru.

She sells groceries, and her business is located in her house.  Her customers are her neighbors and acquaintances.  

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to stock her business.  This way she will have greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío de Santa Clara distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, frejol, maíz, café, ganadería y comercio, a dos horas con treinta minutos de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia tienen una bodega donde ofrecen todo tipo de abarrotes, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de productos de primera necesidad y una segunda parte para la compra de utensilios de cocina y así tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 48 years old. He lives with his spouse and children in the Santa Clara community in the Callayuc district. The people grow sugar cane, corn, coffee and livestock. It's two hours and thirty minutes from the city of Cutervo.

Together with his family, he has a store where they sell all types of groceries. He has requested this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to stock his business with the purchase of basic need products. Another part of the loan is for the purchase of kitchen utensils. With these purchases, he will have larger profits for his family.

loans.use: purchase basic necessity products and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married mother of two children, both children go to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Caroline has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish, meat, pepper, oil, rice, salt, and onion.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.


For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 


With the KES 50,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the business, remodel the space, and buy wholesale supplies (sodas, snacks, beer, candy, and more).

loans.name: Voliet

texts.en:
Meet Voliet.  She is 45 years old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

For the past 25 years, Voliet has managed her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her family's standard of living.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Voliet requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks, such as drinks and pure water, to expand her business. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business.

In the future, Voliet plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Beatrice was born in Makeni city, 40 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple have 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Beatrice sells market food like tomatoes, onions, salt, and cooking oil. She has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Beatrice and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Beatrice will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy tomatoes, onions, salt, cooking oil, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, salt, cooking oil, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the  region of Mbarara in Uganda. He is married and has four children. One of them is currently in school. For the past three years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his model shop, which sells soft drinks, tea, eggs, water, toilet paper and other items. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for business expansion and to buy more items like drinks, water, and eggs. This will help Jimmy to generate greater profits and educate his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more shops. 

Jimmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jimmy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy more items like drinks, water, and eggs

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is 21 years old and lives in Tulkarem. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, as his parents’ income is low, but he didn’t surrender to the conditions. He started working at the structure field, and now he has good experience.


Laith is asking Ryada for this loan to repair his house. He wants to pave the house and make a ceiling in it, which will help to warm his house, especially now in the winter. 


He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Santhiaba Mosquee Group

texts.fr: Le Banc Villageois qui abrite ce groupe est créé le 11 Mai 2001. Il a été constitué sur la base d'affinité et d'entente de  ces membres. Elles ont toujours remboursé leurs prêts à temps sens difficulté. Madame Ndeye Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle s'active dans le domaine de la vente de petit déjeuner depuis plus de quatre année. Elle va acheter en gros avec le prêt sollicité des denrées telles que du petit poids, haricots, oignons, pomme de terre etc... Elle a une clientèle très fidèle. les bénéfices générés par son activité serviront à prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de participer à la dépense quotidienne de la famille où elle vit.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' which houses this group was created on May 11, 2001, and it was constituted based on the affinity and understanding between its members. The members have always paid back their loans on time without difficulty. Ms. Ndeye Fatou, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is unmarried and has no children. She has been active  in the domain of selling breakfasts for over four years. 

With the loan requested, she is going to purchase in bulk some supplies, such as peas, beans, onions, potatoes, etc… She has very loyal customers. The profits generated by her business will be used to meet her personal needs and to help cover the expenses of the family in which she lives.

loans.use: to purchase products wholesale to sell breakfasts

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du village et ceux des villages environnants. Leur principale activité est le commerce. les membres entretiennent de très bonne relations entres eux.
Rosalie, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle s'investit dans le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis fort longtemps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter une tonne de riz, 04 bidons d'huile de 20 L, 12 paquets de bonbons, 01 sac d'oignon et autres produits. Elle travaille en collaboration avec son mari.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne, d'entretenir sa famille et de prendre en charge ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 22 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on December 21, 2009. It is composed of women from the village and those from surrounding villages. Their main work is in commerce. The members maintain very good ties between themselves.

Rosalie, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 24 years old, married, and the mother of four children, including two boys. She is invested in her business, which she has been working at for a long time. She has very good experience in this domain.

With the loan, she is going to purchase a tonne of rice, four 20-liter containers of oil, 12 packets of candy, a sack of onions, and other products. She works in collaboration with her husband. The profits will enable her to bolster her savings, take care of her family, and support herself.

loans.use: to sell grocery items

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Isidoro agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente muy contento por ayuda brindada, él continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de ceviche en su pequeño puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Isidoro sigue participando en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limón, pescado, sal, camote, maíz entre otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Isidoro is grateful to the lenders for the loan.  He is very happy about the provided help.  He continues with his business of selling ‘ceviche’ [marinated seafood] at his small stand.  

He has been working in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  Isidoro continues to participate in his communal bank, and it is going very well for him.

He now needs the loan to buy supplies like limes, fish, salt, sweet potatoes, and corn, among other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies like limes, fish, salt, sweet potatoes, and corn, among other things.

loans.name: Elias Junior

texts.es:
Elias vive en la ciudad de Camana, trabaja como obrero agrícola en varios fundos de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante y poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Elias esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas ya que actualmente tiene una cocina a kerosene, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en: Elias lives in the city of Camana. He is a farm worker for several municipal organizations. With this income, he supports himself and his family. Elias thanks Kiva lenders, whose help will allow him to buy a gas stove to replace his kerosene stove. This will improve his standard of living and help him realize his great dream: to finish his well-made house.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is 30 years old and from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children.  For the past 10 years, Fatmata has had her established food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support the home. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand the business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa, a 20-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child aged 3 years.  Over the past three years, Hawa established her general store business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her family's standard of living.    She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of items: cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items: cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Henry Paul

texts.es:
Henry Paul tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que se encuentra ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida y jugos en su restaurant sus hijos y esposa le apoyan en esta labor, ubicado en su domicilio es conocido por el buen servicio que ofrece, también brinda servicio de trasporte público en su propia mototaxi.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 800 nuevos soles para arreglar el local de su negocio y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para acoger a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Henry Paul is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and child in the district of Pucará, two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here are involved in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

For the past 3 years Henry Paul has been selling meals and juice in his restaurant. His wife and his children help him in his work. It is located in their home and is known for it's good service. He also offers transportation services with his own motorcycle-taxi.

Henry Paul has requested a loan of 2800 PEN to fix up the cafe and in this way have an pleasant spot to take care of his clients.

loans.use: to fix up his cafe.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio donde ofrece venta de todo tipo de abarrotes, arroz, leche, huevos, menestras, entre otros, también se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores porcinos y pavos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para abastecer su bodega con la compra de productos de primera necesidad y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: María, 53, lives in the Morropon district, located two hours from the city of Piura on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. María has a store in her house, where she sells groceries like rice, milk, eggs, beans, and more. She also raises and sells small animals like pigs and turkeys. She has applied for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy basic items for her store and to buy feed so that she has more output to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery items and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kely Ruth

texts.es:
Kely Ruth tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida al paso, desde hace más de 10 años, es conocida por la buen gusto que ofrece en cada plato, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles, para la compra de insumos y utensilios de cocina y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
